After excluding patients with a history of emergent PCI, we isolated 306 patients with elective PCI during the last 24 months prior to CABG (Group 1) and compared them to 452 age-genderand EuroSCORE-matched patients without history of previous PCI, who underwent CABG during the same period (Group 2) in terms of perioperative mortality and complications and Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACEs).

Results. Both groups were comparable concerning preoperative EuroSCORE (Group 1: 4.83 AE 0.18, Group 2: 4.72 AE 0.14, p ¼ 0.63). Patients who underwent previous elective PCI before CABG had an increased perioperative mortality (4.4% vs. 2.4%, p < 0.001) and MACEs (7.9% vs. 4.3%, p < 0.001). This fact was associated with a worse logistic perioperative outcome (p ¼ 0.044). The incidence of bleeding complications (5.9% vs. 3.8%, p ¼ 0.017), the number of blood products (1.70 AE 0.31 vs. 0.61 AE 0.17, p < 0.001) used, as well as the incidence of acute renal failure (5.9% vs. 2.7%, p ¼ 0.025) and renal replacement therapy (3.6% vs. 1.7%, p ¼ 0.03) were higher in patients of the Group 1.

Conclusions. Patients with previous elective PCI have a worse perioperative outcome in terms of mortality, MACE and perioperative complications. This fact should be considered in risk stratification for patients scheduled for elective CABG. Grundlagen. Die Prävalenz des Vorhoflimmerns (VHF) in den ersten Tagen nach herzchirurgischen Eingriffen wird übereinstimmend mit ca. 25-40% angegeben. VHF ist mit vermindertem output, zusätzlichen Therapiekosten und verlängertem Aufenthalt in Ü berwachungseinheiten assoziiert. Ä tiologisch können Oxidationsschäden durch Trauma und HLM beteiligt sein.

Methodik. In einer randomisierten Interventionsstudie mit 2 Â 2 factorial design erhalten vier Gruppen 1) Plazebo (Kontrolle), 2) 3-Fettsäure (präoperativ), 3) -Tocopherol und Ascorbinsäure (intraoperativ), oder 4) Kombination aus 1 und 2). U.a. werden Proteinox, Lipidox, oLAb, Peroxide, Peroxidase-Aktivität, MDA-LDL-IgM Antikörper zu 10 Zeitpunkten bestimmt und während 96 Stunden ein Holter-EKG ausgewertet.

Ergebnisse. Erste (vorläufige) Ergebnisse nach (dzt.) 71 Patienten (Männer, 65,4 Jahre, Ø 3,7 grafts) weisen auf einen signifikanten und günstigen Effekt in den Gruppen 3 und 4 (im Vergleich zu 1 und 2) hin. Die Prävalenz des VHF beträgt 20% (vs. 38% in der Kontrollgruppe). Die Dauer des VHF ist in allen Therapiegruppen kürzer. Eine massive Stressbelastung mit Sauerstoffradikalen hat ihr Maximum am 2. postoperativen Tag und korreliert exakt mit dem Beginn des VHF. Diese Assoziationen sind in den Therapiegruppen teilweise verhinderbar und können den günstigen Effekt erklären.

Schlussfolgerungen. Diese ersten Ergebnisse weisen auf einen Zusammenhang zwischen dem Beginn des postoperativen VHF und Markern der Belastung mit Sauerstoffradikalen hin. Zeit-und Dosisgerechte Intervention mit 3-Fettsäuren und=oder antioxidativen Vitaminen haben das Potential, die Häufigkeit und Dauer des VHF zu reduzieren. Komplikationen, Kosten und Aufenthaltsdauer der Patienten könnten gesenkt werden. Background. The intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP) has a well-established place in algorithms for managing low-cardiacoutput-syndrome (LCOS) following cardiac surgery. The aim of the present study was to determine the effect of preoperative IABP in pts. undergoing coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) in a LCOS situation.

Methods. In a five year period 33 consecutive pts. (27 male, six female, mean age 64.9 years) who had CABG presenting severe LCOS entered the study. All pts. were treated by preoperative IABP and maximal pharmacological support. 25 pts. had a 3vessel-disease, six pts. had 2-vessel-disease and two pts. had a 1-vessel-disease. Eight pts. were in LCOS because of a acute dissection of one coronary artery after PTCA. In six pts. rupture of papillary muscle was diagnosed.

Results. A mean number of 2.6 bypass grafts was performed. Six pts. underwent additional mitral valve replacement. Weaning from extracorporeal circulation was possible in 28 cases under IABP and low or medium dosages of catecholamines. In three cases additional mechanical circulatory support was necessary (2 Biomedicus, 1 Abiomed). Two pts. received a CardioWest total artificial heart in irreversible myocardial infarction shock with consecutive successful Htx. Eight pts. (24%) died because of multiorgan failure (6) or brain death (2).

Conclusions. Preoperative insertion of IABP can be performed safely in LCOS pts. undergoing CABG. Implantation of IABP leads to rapid hemodynamic stabilization in the majority of cases and may avoid catastrophic outcomes in these high-risk patient group. Grundlagen. Trotz zunehmender handchir. Spezialisierung und Versorgung in spez. Zentren kommt es leider nach wie vor bei Dupuytrenoperationen zu iatrogenen Durchtrennungen der digitalen Fingernerven, die nicht erkannt werden.

Es kommt durch die Durchtrennung zu schmerzhaften Neuromen und dadurch zu rasch auftretenden Rezidiven der dupuytrenschen Erkrankung. Anhand von einigen Fallbeispielen wird auf die Häufigkeit der Durchtrennung eingegangen sowie auf die möglichen Rekonstruktionen der betroffenen Nerven.

Methodik. Bei Rezidiven mit Nervendurchtrennung und posttraumatischen Neurombildungen wird die Wiederherstellung des Nervs unbedingt durchgeführt, da es sonst zu neuerlichen Neuromen und Rezidivbildungen kommt. Als Rekonstruktionsmethode kommt, bei Defekten nach Resektion des Neuroms unter 3 cm, die Interposition einer Vene (Methode nach ,,Chiu und Strauch'' in Betracht. Bei längeren Defekten muss eine Suralis Interposition durchgeführt werden. Fallweise muss auch eine Lappenplastik zur Hautdeckung erfolgen.

Ergebnisse. Bei Rezidiven nach dupuytrenscher Kontraktur, bei iatrogener Durchtrennung der digitalen Nerven, die nicht primär bemerkt und auch bei der keine Rekonstruktion erfolgte, muss zur bleibenden Ergebnissicherung der Nerv rekonstruiert werden. Die beiden Rekonstruktionsmethoden wurden bereits erwähnt und evt. muss auch gleichzeitig eine Hautplastik zum spannungsfreien Verschluss erfolgen.

Schlussfolgerungen. Durch diese Methode kann ein zumindest dauerhafteres Ergebnis, ohne Rezidiv, erreicht werden. The causes and pathogenesis of Dupuytren's disease (DD) are still unclear and very controversial. In principle, fibrotic changes develop as a consequence of four main types of primary events: (a) tissue destruction (e.g. liver cirrhosis); (b) inflammation (e.g. rheumatoid arthritis, arteriosclerosis); (c) contact with foreign body material (e.g. silicone implants); (d) spontaneous (e.g. DD). In the first three instances, it has been shown that significant numbers of mononuclear cells are present within the connective tissue mass that produce profibrotic cytokines.

The present work is a first attempt to elucidate the possible mechanisms underlying ''spontaneous'' fibrotic diseases taking DD as a representative example. Surgically obtained tissue and blood samples of 100 DD patients were analysed by immunohistochemistry, flow cytometry, ELISA, immunoscope, tissue and cell culture techniques.

The results are proof of massive infiltration by mononuclear cells (CD3þ, CD4> CD8, CD45RO > CD45RA, S100, CD56, CD68, few CD19, mast cells) forming dense perivascular clusters in DD. Fibromatosis derived T-cells showed a clear tendency to an oligonally resticted T-cell receptor repertoire, in contrast to the polyclonal pattern of autologous peripheral blood derived T-cells.

Thus, it can be stated that inflammatory immunologic processes and a predominantely T-cell dependent and T-cell immune response could be involved in the pathogenesis of palmar fibromatosis. Ongoing studies aim at identifying the functional properties of these mononuclear cell subpopulations.

This work is supported by the Lore-and Udo-Saldow Foundation, Medizinische Forschungs-Fonds Tirol (MFF) and Kompetenzzentrum Medizin Tirol (KMT Ergänzung. 3 Patienten der Gruppe offen hatten ein Doppelkarzinom, 1 Patient der Gruppe laparoskopisch war nicht zu werten, daher ergibt sich eine abweichende Gesamtzahl.

Ergebnisse. Die Gesamt 30d-Mortalitätsrate lag bei 1,1%. Je ein Patient verstarb in der offenen und laparoskopischen Gruppe postoperativ an Organversagen. Bei beiden Patienten lag eine maligne Erkrankung vor. Die Morbiditätsrate betrug 12% (13=108) in der offenen Gruppe und 6,3% (15=80) in der laparoskopischen Gruppe. 2=13 (15%) Komplikationen (1 Ileus nach 3 Monaten, 1 Nachblutung) führten nach offener Primäroperation zu einer Reoperation, alle 5 Komplikationen nach laparoskopischer Operation mussten offen reoperiert werden (2 Â Ileus nach 1,5 und 4 Monaten, 2 Â Nachblutung, 1 akutes Abdomen). Die Gesamt-Reoperationsrate betrug 3,7% (1,8% nach offener, 6,3% nach laparoskopischer Operation). Background. Laparoscopic colorectal cancer surgery is increasingly accepted, since oncologic adequacy has been suggested.

Methods. We have analyzed our recent experience with n ¼ 53 laparoscopic colorectal cancer resections (n ¼ 24 anterior resections, n ¼ 11 abdominoperineal resections, n ¼ 12 sigmoid resections; 1 ileocoecal resection; 2 left-sided, 1 right-sided, 2 total colectomy).

Results. Three cases were not completed laparoscopically (conversion rate 6%). Reconstruction -in patients receiving anastomosis -was predominantly performed with transanal stapling (n ¼ 40 cases). Only 3 patients received extracorporal hand-sewn anastomoses (right-sided colectomies and ileocoecal resection). A protective loop-ileostomy was created in 9 patients after low anterior resection. Histopathologic work-up demonstrated locally limited tumors (pTis=pT1=pT2) in 26 cases, and locally advanced tumors (pT3=pT4) in 27 cases. Thrity two patients were nodal negative (N0), whereas 21 cases showed nodal involvement. A mean number of 15 lymph nodes was removed [standard deviation 7; range . The mean number of infiltrated nodes was 1.6 [SD 3.3; range 0-14]. A complete (R0) tumor resection was achieved in 50 (94.5%) of the cases. In 2 of 3 cases an R2 resection was already recognized intraoperatively. Although follow-up is too short to make a definitive judgement (26.5 [15-37] months), survival seems to equal open surgery.

Conclusions. In experienced hands and well-selected patients, laparoscopic colon resection is feasible, meets oncologic requirements and results in favourable results, which can easily compete with open surgery. In our experience this applies especially to all forms of laparoscopic rectal cancer surgery. Bei 33 Patienten (37,87%) konnte eine laparoskopische Operation durchgeführt werden, ohne Umstieg auf offene Technik. Die laparoskopische Technik ermöglicht uns durch die herausragende Sicht im kleinen Becken die vollständige TME durchzuführen, unter sicherer Schonung der hier laufenden genito-urinalen Nerven. Auch die synchron -mit zwei Operationsteams -durchgeführte intersphinktäre Resektion bietet eine nervenschonende und schnelle Technik durch die Anwendung der laparoskopischen Präparation bis zum intersphinktären Spalt und teils parallel durch das Team im peranalen Bereich. Neue Techniken und deren kombinierte Anwendung können neben dem Beibehalten der onkologischen Prinzipien zur schnelleren Genesung und Erhöhung der Lebensqualität der Patienten beitragen.

First minimal invasive peritonectomy with intraperitoneal chemotherapy in a patient with pseudomyxoma peritonei Background. Pseudomyxoma peritonei (PMP) is a rare complication after rupture of an appendiceal mucocele and associated with pure prognosis in the absence of cytoreductive therapy. Combined peritonectomy with hyperthermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy favours the outcome, however this procedure is associated with substantial postoperative morbidity. We describe the first case of minimally invasive peritonectomy with combined intraoperative hyperthermic chemotherapy in a patient with PMP.

Methods. A 21-year-old woman underwent diagnostic laparoscopy due to aggravating lower abdominal pain. A perforated appendix, mucous masses in the Douglas space and miliar lesions in the parietal peritoneum, arousing suspicion for PMP, were found. Histology revealed a benign mucinous tumor of the appendix and confirmed PMP in biopsies taken from the peritoneum. 10 days after appendectomy, laparoscopic peritonectomy and intraoperative hyperthermic chemotherapy with mitomycin C (30 mg=m 2 ) have been carried out.

Results. Due to a restricted tumor spreading onto the parietal right hemiperitoneum no organ resection was necessary. Laparoscopic peritonectomy and intraperitoneal hyperthermic chemotherapy by use of a closed cycle perfusion system was carried out successfully. The procedure was well tolerated by the patient, neither intra-nor postoperative complications occurred. She was dismissed on postoperative day eight in an excellent condition.

Conclusions. We here describe the worldwide first case of a laparoscopic peritonectomy with a combined intraoperative intraperitoneal hyperthermic chemotherapy in a patient with PMP. The minimally invasive approach resulted in a good cosmetic result and rapid recovery of the patient and should be considered as a therapeutic option in patients with PMP and limited spreading. Background. Laparoscopic liver resection is nowadays considered for surgical treatment of hepatic malignancies. We developed a novel interdisciplinary approach using navigated radiofrequency ablation (RFA) to guide minimal invasive liver resection to increase procedural safety in patients with limited parenchymal hepatic mass.

Methods. We report on two patients suffering from multiple bilateral liver metastases. Patients were bedded on a body fixation device and received CT acquisition, 3D-planning of possible resection planes and central metastases, navigation, targeting, needle placement in apnea and synchronous thermal ablation. Thereafter laparoscopic liver resection was carried out respecting the preformed necrotic planes.

Results. All procedures were completed laparoscopically. Navigated thermal ablations of the resection planes were successfully carried out to guide resection of segments II, III, IVa in both patients. Laparoscopic atypical resections (metastasectomies) were performed to remove tumors in segments VI and VII. Metastases in segments V and VIII were treated by means of navigated RFA. Determined blood loss was 50 ml and 250 ml. Incisions for specimen removal yielded 7 cm. No complication occurred. Patients were discharged on day 7 and 8, respectively.
Conclusions. This novel approach allows safe parenchyma sparing laparoscopic liver resections. The benefits of minimally invasive liver surgery countervail against higher procedural demands.
Laparoscopic liver resection compared to navigated RFA-guided liver resection in a porcine model

Background. Laparoscopy has become more important in the surgical treatment of liver diseases. Since technical devices are by far not optimized yet we evaluated a novel approach for minimal invasive liver resection in an animal model.

Methods. Twelve housepigs were enrolled in this study for left-lobe liver resection. Six animals (Group 1) were bedded on a body fixation device and received CT acquisition, 3D-planning of resection plane, navigation, targeting, needle placement in apnea and synchronous thermal ablation. Thereafter resection was carried out laparoscopically. Six animals (Group 2) underwent laparoscopic liver resection using bipolar energy sources, staplers and clips. Animals were sacrificed after the procedure. Procedural parameters, thermal necrosis and serum markers (CRP, IL-6, LFP) were assessed.

Results. All but one procedures were completed laparoscopically. One conversion (Group 2) was carried out to manage bleeding from the left hepatic vein. Mean blood loss yielded 16 ml in Group 1 and 92 ml in Group 2 (p ¼ 0.001). No bile leak was observed. Navigated RFA sufficiently prepared resection plane in Group 1 animals (no staplers in Group 1 compared to 4 staplers=procedure in Group 2). Overall procedural time was 93 min (Group 1) and 34 min (Group 2, p ¼ 0.001). Time for laparoscopic resection was not different between both groups. Histology revealed necrotic margins of 9 mm and 2 mm in Group 1 and 2, respectively. Serum marker profiles were not significantly different in both groups.

Conclusions. This novel approach of navigated RFA-guided laparoscopic liver resection allows accurate preparation of the resection plane adding operative safety, reducing blood loss and the need for staplers. This benefit countervails against higher total procedural demands.
Integration einer Navigationsumgebung (LapAssistent) für die ultraschallnavigierte laparoskopische Leberchirurgie M. Kleemann, P. Hildebrand, U. Roblick, C. Bürk, H. Bruch

Grundlagen. Auch an der Leber lassen sich die Vorteile der minimal invasiven Therapie nachweisen. Kontrovers diskutiert wird die Gefahr der Tumorzellverschleppung und der Trokarkanalmetastasen bei malignen Prozessen. Vergleichende Untersuchungen zur konventionellen offenen Leberchirurgie fehlen. Kurzzeitdaten belegen jedoch, dass bei entsprechender Patientenselektion vergleichende Ergebnisse wie bei offener Leberresektion erzielt werden können.

Methodik. Ein Hauptproblem bei der Durchfü hrung von laparoskopischen Leberresektionen liegt in der korrekten Bestimmung der Tumorlage anhand des laparoskopischen Ultraschallbildes in Relation zu den geplanten Resektionsgrenzen. Taktile Zusatzinformationen fehlen in der Laparoskopie hier fast vollständig.

Ergebnisse. Aus dieser Problematik ergibt sich die Notwendigkeit zur Entwicklung eines laparoskopischen Navigationssystems. Daher war es unser Ziel, durch die Realisierung eines ultraschallnavigierten laparoskopischen Navigationsassistenz-systems die minimal-invasive Chirurgie an der Leber zu unterstü tzen.

Das Background. With the widespread availability and use of maternal ultrasonography, the incidence of urinary tract disorders diagnosed in utero has increased substantially. But it is well accepted that urinary tract dilatation does not always indicate the need of treatment. On the other hand there are patients presenting severe urinary tract infection due to a urinary disorder, which has not been antenatally diagnosed.

Methods. We analysed the records of all children under the first year of life (n ¼ 194) at our institution who underwent evaluation for hydronephrosis. The cause of hydronephrosis, the existence of antenatal detection, complications, renal impairment and the mode of treatment were retrospectively reviewed. All neonates with hydronephrosis achieved low-dose antibiotic therapy till the clarification of cause was completed. Nuclear scan has been performed to evaluate renal function.

Seventy five percent of our patients were antenatally diagnosed, whereas 25% presented acute abdominal pain and urinary tract infection during the first year of life. These patients underwent consecutively appropriate investigations. The necessity of urinary diversion was higher in those patients without the existence of antenatal diagnosis.

Results and conclusions. Our data showed a better outcome for patients with antenatally diagnosed urinary disorder due to early treatment. The delayed investigation in patients, where hydronephrosis was not detected in utero, led to more complications with a higher risk of renal damage and to a more complex surgical repair.
Hodenhochstandwie agieren?
Klinische Abteilung für Kinderchirurgie, Universitätsklinik für Chirurgie, Medizinische Universität Wien, Wien, Österreich

Grundlagen. Der Hodenhochstand ist eine der häufigsten urologischen Fehlbildungen. Ein nicht behandelter Hodenhochstand kann in Infertilität enden. Ein evidenzbasiertes und allgemein akzeptiertes Behandlungsschema steht noch immer aus. In dieser Studie werden die Behandlungsgepflogenheiten der niedergelassenen österreichischen Kinderärzte untersucht und mit aktuellen internationalen Behandlungsrichtlinien verglichen.

Methodik. In einer prospektiven Studie wurden alle niedergelassen Kinderärzte in Ö sterreich, von denen die Emailadresse der Ö sterreichischen Gesellschaft fü r Kinder-und Jugendheilkunde bekannt war, angeschrieben und ein online beantwortbarer Fragebogen zugesandt. Der Fragebogen besteht aus 8 Items zum Thema Hodenhochstand.

Ergebnisse. Die Lage der Hoden wird zum ersten Mal mit 0,57 Wochen (0 bis 4 Wochen) kontrolliert. Der Hodenhochstand wird ab dem 11,1 Lebensmonat (1 bis 20 Monate) behandelt. Die Kinder werden mit 16,3 Monaten (6 bis 36 Monate) zur chirurgischen Therapie überwiesen. Die Lage der Hoden wird bis zum 8,2 Lebensjahr (3 bis 16 Jahre) kontrolliert. Nach Ansicht der gefragten Kinderärzte sollte der Hodenhochstand bis zum 24. Lebensmonat (12 bis 60 Monate) therapiert sein.

Schlussfolgerungen. Im europäischen und US-amerikanischen Vergleich wird in Ö sterreich der Hodenhochstand spät therapiert. Der internationale Trend geht dazu über, die Therapie bis zum 12. Lebensmonat abgeschlossen zu haben. Die Hormontherapie wird zunehmend kritisch betrachtet. Dazu wird die aktuelle Literatur beleuchtet.

Long term fertility results of cryptorchism T. Meyer 1 , F. Tatzel 1 , F. Hadziselimovic 2 , B. Höcht 1 Background. Delayed orchidopexy for undescended testis has been associated with abnormal testicular histology, but its functional effect on later fertility is unknown.

Methods. All patients (now >18 years old) who underwent orchidopexy and testicular biopsy during their first two years of life at our department were contacted. Until now 18 patients responded and were assessed using a sexual history, physical examination, hormonal -and sperm -analysis. We matched histological findings of the testicular biopsy (present or absent of Ad spermatogonia) with their total number of sperm.

Results. Six patients had bilateral and 12 patients had unilateral cryptorchism. If Ad spermatogonia were present (8=18) in testicular biopsy, 6 (75%) had a total sperm count of 40 Â 10 6 =ejaculate or greater. By contrast, if Ad spermatogonia were absent (10=18), all patients had abnormal spermiograms. There was no correlation between the total number of sperm and the levels of follicle-stimulating-hormone (FSH) or the testicular locatisation.

Conclusions. Our results showed that only in 33% of all cases a normal spermiogram could be found. The transformation of gonocytes into Ad spermatogonia might to be crucial for the male development and seems to be the best indicator of future fertility. Schlussfolgerungen. Eine Meatusstenose ist eine selten vorkommende Affektion, die durch eine einfache, aber sehr subtil vorzunehmende Erweiterungsplastik (Lupenbrille) problemlos behandelt werden kann.

Background. Inguinal hernia repair is one of the commonest operations performed in pediatric surgical practice. To evaluate the complication rate, rate of irreponible hernias, recurrence rate and the incidence of metachronous bilateral inguinal hernia the charts of all patients, treated for inguinal hernia in children, between 1996 and 2007 were reviewed.

Methods. Over a 11-year's period 3349 pediatric hernia repairs of two centers (Department of General and Thoracic Surgery, Feldkirch and Division of Pediatric Surgery, General Hospital, Vienna) were reviewed retrospectively.

Results. 2.1% of all hernias were irreponible and treated on an emergent basis. 12% were bilateral, 56% rightsided and 32% leftsided inguinal hernias. 0.4% were operated on a recurrent leftsided and 1.1% on recurrent rightsided inguinal hernia. 0.5% had a metachronous rightsided and 0.9% a metachronous leftsided hernia.

Conclusions. Although inguinal hernia repair is one of the commonest operations in pediatric surgical practice, many questions remain unanswered. When to operate a groin hernia in a premature infant? How to avoid metachronous hernias? How to avoid irreponible hernias?
Pheochromocytoma in children: personal experience

Medical University, Lviv, Uktraine, Lviv, Ukraine Pheocromocytoma is one of the causes of arterial hypertension in children. Attempts to treat the arterial hypertension without clear establishing of its etiology lead to the development serious changes in cardiovascular system with the high risk of lethality.

This study summarized results of treatment of 9 children with pheochromocytoma. The mean age was 12.3 AE 2.1. The urinary metanephrine level, ultrasonography and CT were applied for the diagnosis of pheochromocytoma. Extraadrenal localization of tumor was in one patient. The unilateral localization of pheochromocytoma was in 8 patients. All patients were operated: in 7 (77.8%) patients conventional adrenalectomy was performed and in 2 (22.2%) -laparoscopic adrenalectomy.

Eight (88.9%) patients had persistent form of hypertension and one (11.1%) patient was normotensive. Except of arterial hypertension, headache (77.8%), palpitation (66.7%), and polyuria (44.4%) were the common symptoms of pheochromocytoma. The hypertensive retinopathy and cardiomyopathy was noted in 2 patients. The elevated level of urinary metanephrine was noted in 8 patients (28.37-59.24 mg=24 h) and in case of normotensive pheochromocytoma this test had a normal value (5.72 mg=24 h). Despite the medication, the intraoperative hypertension was noted in 3 patients that required the infusion of sodium nitroprusside. The conventional adrenalectomy was performed through lumbotomy in 6 patients and in one patient with the extraadrenal localization of pheochromocytoma -through transabdominal approach. The laparoscopic adrenalectomy was performed through retroperitoneal approach. The duration of conventional and laparoscopic adrenalectomy had no significant differences. Pathologic features suggestive of benign character of tumor were noted in all patients. Grundlagen. Die Rezidivhäufigkeit nach Fundoplikatio ist signifikant höher, wenn die Operation bei kataboler Stoffwechsellage durchgeführt wird. Ziel der prospektiven Studie ist die Identifizierung möglicher Laborparameter zum Monitoring der präoperativen Stoffwechsellage.

Methodik. Seit 2003 wurde bei insgesamt 12 dystrophen Reflux-Patienten (1-42a, Ø 17a, BMI unter der 10. Perzentile) vor der geplanten Fundoplikatio eine Stoffwechselabklärung hinsichtlich folgender Laborparamenter durchgefü hrt: Präalbumin, Cholinesterase (CHE), Zink, Laktat, TNF-Alpha, CRP und Transferrin wurden in wöchentlichem Abstand präoperativ und bis zu 24 Wochen postoperativ bestimmt. Weiters wurden der Body-Mass-Index (BMI) und die Kalorienaufnahme sowohl enteral als auch parenteral dokumentiert. Der Energiequotient der Patienten wurde durch Anpassung der Nahrungszufuhr optimiert. Die Fundoplikatio erfolgte bei Normalisierung des Präalbuminwertes. Prä-und postoperativ wurde die Refluxdiagnostik mittels pH-Metrie, Ö sophaguspassage sowie endoskopischen Biopsien komplettiert.

Ergebnisse. Präalbumin, CHE und Transferrin reagierten durch konstanten Anstieg rasch auf die gesteigerte Energiezufuhr und erwiesen sich als empfindlichste Marker zur Monitorisierung der Stoffwechsellage. Zink, Laktat, TNF-Alpha und CRP waren wie auch der BMI nicht entsprechend aussagekräftig, da sie nicht in allen Fällen mit der Stoffwechsellage korrelierten. Zehn der inkludierten Patienten wurden fundopliziert, wobei bisher keine Rezidive auftraten. Bei zwei weiteren Patienten besserte sich der Ernährungszustand signifikant, so dass die Eltern eine Antirefluxplastik vorerst ablehnen.

Schlussfolgerungen. Präalbumin, CHE und Transferrin erwiesen sich als wertvolle Marker zur Monitorisierung des Ernährungszustandes von dystrophen Refluxpatienten. Die präoperative Anpassung der Ernährung und die Optimierung des OP-Zeitpunktes führten vorerst zu einer Verbesserung der Rezidivrate.
Ösophago-gastrale Dissoziation bei ausgeprägtem gastro-ösophagealem Reflux (GÖR) bei tetraspastischen Kinderneine Alternative zur konventionellen Fundoplikatio
Landes-, Frauen-und Kinderklinik, Linz, Österreich

Grundlagen. Die Fundoplikatio ist der Standardeingriff bei Kindern mit GÖ R, bei denen die konservative Therapie nicht zum Erfolg führt. Bei Kindern mit zusätzlichen Fehlbildungen, besonders bei tetraspastischen Kindern, ist mit einer hohen Rezidivrate (12-45%) zu rechnen. Bianchi beschrieb 1997 erstmals die ösophago-gastrale Dissoziation als Alternativeingriff zur Fundoplikatio. Damit ist es möglich, dass langfristig kein Rezidiv entstehen kann und die Patienten von Seiten des Refluxes beschwerdefrei bleiben.

Methodik. Die Indikation zur Operation wird nach entsprechender Diagnosesicherung durch ein Magenröntgen, einer histologischen Verifizierung der Refluxkrankheit im Rahmen einer Gastroskopie und evt. einer pH-metrie gestellt. Die Operation beginnt mit der Darstellung des gastro-ösophagealen Ü berganges wie zu einer Fundoplikatio. Anschließend wird das Jejunum 35 cm nach der Treitz'schen Flexur durchtrennt und der distale Schenkel retrocolisch an den Ö sophagus gebracht. Nach Absetzen des Magens vom Ö sophagus wird die Cardia verschlossen. Nun erfolgt die ösophago -jejunale End-zu-Seit-Anastomose. Im Anschluss an die Fußpunktanastomose wird bei Verdacht auf eine Magenentleerungsstörung eine Pyloroplastik durchgeführt und abschließend eine Gastrostomie für die Ernährung mit einem Gastrotube angelegt.

Ergebnisse. Im Zeitraum vom März 2006 bis zum Oktober 2007 haben wir 3 tetraspastische Kinder mit schwerem gastroösophagealem Reflux operiert. Zwei Kinder waren 9 Jahre, eines 17 Jahre alt. Bei allen drei Kindern wurde der GÖ R radiologisch und histologisch verifiziert. Ein Kind hatte bereits vor der Operation eine PEG-Sonde, ein weiteres eine jejunale Sonde über eine PEG. Alle Kinder hatten in der Anamnese rezidivierende Aspirationspneumonien.

Bei allen Kindern war der perioperative Verlauf problemlos. Ein Kind hatte eine Wundheilungsstörung, diese heilte aber spontan ab. Zwei Kinder sind jetzt 8 bzw. 22 Monate nach der Operation beschwerdefrei und die Pflege daheim ist problemlos. Beide Kinder nehmen adäquat an Gewicht zu. Das dritte Kind verstarb 1 Woche nach dem Eingriff nach anfänglicher Besserung an einem zentralen therapierefraktären Fieber ohne direkten Zusammenhang mit der Operation. Dies wurde auch in der Obduktion bestätigt.

Schlussfolgerungen. Die ösophago-gastrale Dissoziationsoperation stellt bei einem GÖ R bei tetraspastischen Kindern eine gute Alternative zur Fundoplikatio dar. Sie ist technisch aufwendiger, demgegenüber profitieren die Patienten aber dadurch, dass der Reflux und seine Symptome beinahe immer (99%) sistieren. Auch langfristig ist mit keinem Rezidiv zu rechnen. Als Indikation sehe ich tetraspastische Patienten mit GÖ R, die wegen einer schlechten Nahrungsaufnahme eine PEG-Sonde benötigen oder bereits haben und Patienten mit schweren anatomischen Veränderungen im Cardia-und Hiatusbereich. Ein wichtiges Ziel bei diesen Kindern ist eine problemlose Sondenernährung ohne Refluxsymptomatik und eine entsprechender Gewichtszunahme. Ergebnisse. Die erweiterte linksseitige Leberresektion mit und ohne Anlage des portocavalen H-Shunts verlief bei allen Tieren problemlos. Das Volumen des verbliebenen rechtslateralen Segmentes erreichte 250% vom Ausgangsvolumen am Ende der ersten postoperativen Woche. Die Fläche der Portalfelder nahm signifikant zu und ebenso die Anzahl der Hepatozyten in den Portalfeldern. Interessanterweise zeigte sich keine Zunahme der Hepatozyten=mm 2 und es fand sich auch kein Unterschied zwischen den Tieren mit und ohne portocavalen Shunt.

Schlussfolgerungen. Nach einer erweiterten Leberresektion wird das Volumen der Leber durch eine ausgeprägte und signifikante Hyperplasie der Leberzellen innerhalb der vorhandenen Portalfelder wiederhergestellt, wobei kein Unterschied besteht, ob ein portosystemischer Shunt angelegt wurde oder nicht.

Analysis of molecular markers of lymphozyte migration in human hand allografts: relevance in skin rejection Background. To understand in greater depth the molecular mechanisms involved in skin rejection in hand transplantation, we investigated 8 key molecular markers of lymphocyte trafficking, cellular rejection and antibody mediated rejection in human hand transplant biopsies.
Methods. One hundred and four skin biopsies taken from three bilateral hand transplants were assessed by H & E histology (graded 0-4b) and immunohistochemistry using antibodies for:
Antigen (HLA)-II (DP,DQ,DR), Psoriasin ¼ S100A7 and C4d. Levels of expression were assessed (0, þ,þ þ,þ þ þ) and read in the light correlated with rejection as well as time after transplantation.

Results. Rejection ranged between grade 0 and 4a with an average score of 0.94. In healthy skin, none of the markers was consistently up-regulated. Upon rejection, CD54, CD62E and CD62P staining in endothelial cells was significantly increased. Expression of CD62E and CD62P correlated well with severity of rejection. The majority of infiltrating lymphocytes stained positive for CD11a. CD144 was detected on endothelial cells, but its occurrence did not correlate with rejection. Psoriasin expression was observed in keratinocytes in a basal and focal pattern and correlated well with rejection. For C4d, no consistent staining pattern was observed indicating that antibody mediated rejection did not play a role in these patients. Strong evidence towards higher expression of all markers at later time-points after transplantation was found.

Conclusions. Molecular markers involved in lymphocyte trafficking are up-regulated upon skin rejection after hand transplantation and represent promising target for prophylaxis and treatment of rejection in Composite Tissue Allotransplantation.

Survival signaling by C-RAF: mitochondrial ROS and Ca 2þ are critical targets A. Kuznetsov 1;2 , J. Smiegelskaite 1;2 , C. Doblander 1;2 , M. Janakiraman 1;2 , M. Hermann 3;2 , M. Wurm 3;2 , R. Sucher 1;2 , J. Troppmair 1;2 RAF kinases feature prominently in human tumor development through mutations in RAF proteins themselves as well as in upstream components. Activated RAF contributes to transformation through enhanced cell cycle progression and prevention of apoptotic cell death. Survival signaling by RAF occurs through largely unknown mechanisms resulting in the maintenance of mitochondrial integrity. Here we provide evidence for the first time that RAF controls cell survival by maintaining permissive levels of mitochondrial reactive oxygen species (ROS) and Ca 2þ . IL-3 withdrawal from 32D cells resulted in ROS production, which was suppressed by activated C-RAF. C-RAF also delayed the onset of apoptosis, following treatment with staurosporine (STS) or the oxidative stress-inducing agent tert-butyl hydroperoxide (t-BHP). Apoptotic cell death is preceded by a ROS-dependent increase in mitochondrial Ca 2þ , which was absent in cells expressing transforming C-RAF. Prevention of mitochondrial Ca 2þ overload after IL-3 deprivation delayed apoptotic cell death. In summary, our data show that survival control by C-RAF involves controlling ROS production, which otherwise perturbs mitochondrial Ca 2þ homeostasis.

MAPK signaling during ischemia and reperfusion: stress kinase regulation of mitochondrial ROS and Ca 2þ homeostasis P. Gehwolf 1;2 , R. Sucher 1;2 , T. Kaier 1;2 , M. Maglione 1;2 , S. Schneeberger 1;2 , G. Brandacher 1;2 , R. Öllinger 1;2 , M. Hermann 3;2 , A. Krutznetzov 1;2 , C. Margreiter 1;2 , H. Weiss 1;2 , R. Margreiter 1;2 , J. Troppmair 1;2 Ischemia (I) and reperfusion (R) trigger a series of events, which culminate in severe injuries to transplanted organs. Reactive oxygen species (ROS) have long been implicated in IR-associated tissue injury (IRI) through effects on pro-apoptotic signaling, mitochondrial function and intracellular Ca 2þ trafficking leading mitochondrial dysfunction and cell death. Intracellular signaling pathways also respond to other cellular changes occurring during I=R and modulate the extent of damage. Using the cardiomyocyte cell line HL-1, primary fetal cardiomyocytes and a heterotopic murine heart transplant model, MAPK activation was assessed in vitro and in vivo. Here we demonstrate that 45 min of ischemia=hypoxia primarily caused the activation of stress kinases p38 and JNK, reoxygenation resulted in a dramatic and almost synchronous increase in ERK, JNK, and p38 activity in vitro as well as in vivo. Stress kinase activity returned to basal levels while ERK1, 2 still were active by the end of the observation period (48 h). Hypoxia also lead to a dramatic increase in mitochondrial ROS production, Ca 2þ levels and apoptosis, which were prevented in the presence of anti-oxidant N-acetyl cysteine (NAC).

Background. The current shortage of organ donors has led many centers to use marginal and nonheart-beating donors. Recent research has implicated the infiltration of leukocytes as an important mediator of ischemia-reperfusion injury (IRI). The fibrin derived peptide B15-42 reduces leukocyte infiltration by inhibiting the transmigration process. In cardiac transplantation and myocardial infarction models it could have been shown that B15-42 reduces IRI in the heart. Now we wanted to test the effects of the peptide on renal ischemia reperfusion injury.

Methods. Male Lewis rats (250-300 g) underwent median laparotomy with removal of the right kidney, followed by clamping of the left renal artery for 60-min. Groups were dived into follow up periods of 24-hours and 7-days, each group was further dived into a control group (IRI only) and a treatment group IRI þ B15-42 (1.2 mg i.v.). Serum samples for the evaluation of creatinine and BUN levels were collected at several time points.

Results. Over the reperfusion period we could observe, that 60-min of ischemia led to increasing Creatinine and BUN levels in the ischemia only group with a peak at day 2. After day 2 renal function recovers and reaches normal levels on day 7 again. The application of B15-42 led to a reduction of Creatinine and BUN levels, which was significant on day 2 and day 5. In animals receiving B15-42 we could measure normal creatinine and BUN levels over the whole reperfusion periode.
Conclusions. Our experiments show that B15-42 is not only a possible agent for cardiac but also for renal ischemia-reperfusion injury.

Schlüsselrolle von Kupfferzell-abhängigem Interleukin 10 in der Immunabwehr der abdominellen Sepsis Background. A complex system of arterial anastomoses between the gastroduodenal, splenic (SA) and superior mesenteric artery (SMA) exists. During pancreas transplantation arterial reconstruction between the SA and SMA is performed by using a donor iliac Y-graft. Graft thrombosis is still responsible for up to 10% of graft losses. The aim of this study was to investigate arterial vascularization of the pancreas with special regard to the anastomoses within the pancreatic head.

Methods. Ten pancreas grafts considered not suitable for transplantation were removed and a canula was inserted into the splenic artery and the SMA ligated. Angiography was performed with 5, 10 and 15 ml of contrast medium. In addition we retrospectively analyzed 15 patients with radiologically proven thrombosis of the SMA with stable graft function.

Results. Angiography showed excellent perfusion of the pancreaticoduodenal arcade via anastomoses in all cases after ex vivo injection of 5 ml of contrast medium into the splenic artery only. All 15 patients analyzed had normal graft function and sufficient perfusion of the pancreatic head.

Conclusions. This study demonstrates that the whole pancreas is sufficiently perfused by the splenic artery only through a complex system of intraparenchymal anastomoses. This finding can be important not only for pancreas transplantation but also for all kinds of pancreatic surgery. What are the results of performing a subtotal thyroid resection after 5 and 10 years? What's the chance of complication? Can long term results justify thyreoidectomy?

Addressing the thyroid recurrence problem and the recurrent operation we evaluated data from 1990-2007 with regard for indication, latency of first surgery and complications. Two groups of patients resected subtotal bilateral (STB) in 1997 or 2002 have been checked up clinically and sonographically (volume, structure).

1990-2007 we resected 250 patients with recurrent thyriod disease. Indicators were hyperthyroid (4%), cold knot (76%) or cancer in definite histology (20%). Latency from frist surgery was 13 years on average. The temporary=permanent recurrence rate was 12.5%=5%, bleeding 1.5%, permanent hypoparathyroid 1.5%.

Our department performed 131 STB in 1997 and 123 in 2002. 40% of all patients attended checkups. The group of 1997 showed in 65.3% insuspicous remaining tissue, 26% showed new knotestque structures that required clearing. 8.7% of all indicators leaded to surgery. The group of 2002 showed insuspicous tissue in 81.5%, 18.5% were recommended szintigraphy; no indicator required surgery.

Higher latency from first surgery resulted more patients showing recurrent goiter. The number of patients requiring regular sonography or szintigraphy because of goiter is 26% after 10 years. Because of a higher complication rate with recurrent surgery indicatiors are considered more carefully. Better long term results following a change of operation strategy are to be expected concerning hemithyreoidectomy=thyreoidectomy. This is especially true for patients with thyroid cancer (final histology). Ergebnisse. 28 Patienten (40%) wurden total thyreoidektomiert. Passagere Hypokalzämien zeigten insgesamt 13 Patienten (7 Pat. nach TT; 6 Pat. nach subtotaler Resektion). Passagere Rekurrensläsionen erlitten 3 Patienten (1:2) sowie Nachblutungen 2 Patienten (1:1). Ingesamt hatten 7 Patienten (10%) ein zufällig entdecktes Karzinom. Es musste kein Patient aufgrund eines Rezidiv-Mb. Basedow nachoperiert werden, ungewiss ist noch, ob über einen längeren postoperativen Beobachtungszeitraum dies nicht noch notwendig werden wird, jedoch sicher ist, dass ein total thyreoidektomierter Patient sicher niemals mehr an der Schilddrüse operiert werden wird müssen.

Schlussfolgerungen. Ein ausgedehnteres Resektionsausmaß scheint neben der geringeren operationsspezifischen Morbidität auch zufällig entdeckte Karzinome optimal therapeutisch zu erfassen. Zudem hat der Patient, der sowieso postoperativ substituiert werden muss, kein Rezidiv zu erwarten. Somit empfehlen wir die totale Thyreoidektomie für jeden Patienten, der wegen eines Mb. Basedow operiert wird.
Virtuelle Halsexploration bei Hyperparathyreoidismus und zervikaler Voroperation

Postoperative haemorrhage after thyroidectomya potential lifethreatening complicationaction instead of reactionan algorithm Background. Postoperative haemorrhage is the only potential life-threatening complication after thyroid surgery. Therefore we analyzed our patients for the incidence of postoperative haemorrhage focusing on critical incidences.

Methods. We carried out a retrospective study including a standardized protocol to analyze the incidence and the critical events in reoperation for acute postoperative haemorrhage after thyroidectomy focusing on patients with an urgent need of tracheotomy.

Results. Out of 26.054 thyroid operations, 428 patients had to undergo reoperation for postoperative haemorrhage (i.e. 1.6%). In 9 of them, tracheal intubation and sufficient oxygenation failed and an acute tracheotomy had to be carried out. We accurately worked up these cases. On the basis of this experience, a standardized procedure for the case of acute airway distress due to acute thyroid haemorrhage has been developed in cooperation with our Department of Anaesthesiology. The guideline includes all steps of clinical procedures, surgical interventions and mod-ern methods and tools for difficult airway management (Bullard-Laryngoscope, GlideScope, Airtrack, Mc Grath).

Conclusions. The airway obstruction due to postoperative haemorrhage after thyroidectomy needs a defined concept of all the immediate medical staff in close cooperation with surgeons, anaesthesiologists, ward physicians, nurses and non-medical personnel e.g. hospital orderly, hospital patient transporters and Operating Room assistants etc. A standardized procedure -a defined and trained algorithm -is mandatory and includes the need of interprofessional and interdisciplinary coordination and cooperation. Background. Previous approaches did not result in routinely practicable continuous nerve stimulation methods for the function of the recurrent laryngeal nerve during thyroid surgery. Therefore, we developed a suitable new vagus-nerve electrode.

Methods. The vagus-nerve electrode is made of an elastic conductive material. It is specially designed, such that it can be wrapped around the vagus-nerve and 'locked' that way, that it remains in its position throughout the entire operation. The new electrode is characterized by selective contact areas extremely well conducting the stimulation current and adapts to different nerve diameters. A prospective study protocol aimed at a systematic investigation of the new tool. The new Avalanche allows us to analyze the variability of electrophysiological responses.

Results. The electrode was used successfully with 54 nerves at risk. The mean delay to apply the electrode around the vagusnerve was 4 min. Repetitive stimulation with 0.5-1.5 mA current provided reliable muscle compound action potentials of the vocal cords. In our data analysis, we will evaluate the different intraoperative continuous electrophysiological responses during thyroid surgery, such as nerve conduction velocity, magnitude of the response or stimulation-threshold for the prediction of imminent recurrent laryngeal nerve injury.

Conclusions. The new vagus-nerve electrode allows acquiring reproducible significant muscle compound action potentials as a result of continuous vagus-nerve stimulation. The search for a practical method of permanent intraoperative information of recurrent nerve function to the surgeon may be achieved successfully. The new goal is the early intraoperative warning of an imminent laryngeal recurrent nerve injury.

Von der Klinik aufs Land. Implementierung eines modernen endokrinchirurgischen Konzeptes an einem peripheren Schwerpunktkrankenhaus Andererseits stellen radiogen bedingte Haut-Weichteilschäden in Form von Indurationen, Narbenkontrakturen, instabilen Narben oder Strahlenulzera für die betroffenen Patienten eine oft dramatische Einschränkung der Lebens-oder Ü berlebensqualität dar und erfordern bestimmte plastisch chirurgische Korrektureingriffe, welche auch oft nur palliativ z.B. zur Schmerzreduktion oder zur Beseitigung einer Funktionsbehinderung indiziert sind.

Da es sich um ein sehr inhomogenes Patientengut mit komplexen Aufgabestellungen im Hinblick auf chirurgische oder multimodale Therapie handelt, ist diese kaum standardmäßig möglich und erfordert den interdisziplinären Diskurs und die verständiger Absprache mit dem Patienten.

Die plastisch rekonstruktiven Techniken wie autologe Gewebetransplanation, Gewebetranspositionen oder Neurolysen z. B. am Plexus brachialis gehören heutzutage zu vielfach geü bten Eingriffen, welche deshalb auch multimorbiden Tumorpatienten angeboten werden sollen. Die Grenzen zwischen Zumutbarkeit, Indikation und Machbarkeit sind dabei oft fliessend und mü ssen individuell an die Erfordernisse und besonderen Wü nsche des Patienten mit einer Tumorerkrankung adaptiert werden.
An Hand mehrerer Casuistiken soll die Diskussion über die Indikation, den Zeitpunkt und die Sinnhaftgkeit von palliativerekonstruktiven Eingriffen nach Spätfolgen einer Tumortherapie geführt werden.

The interdisciplinary tumour board in a community hospital: the best available tool for quality and safety control for the cancer patient Background. About 70% of all cancer patients, which is the majority, receive most of their cancer care in community hospitals. The tumor board in our community hospital offers a multidisciplinary patient-oriented conference that leads to improved cancer patient care and education of the treating physicians as well.

Methods. Multidisciplinary experts dealing with cancer care meet at a weekly schedule. These experts' consensus-decisions are documented by protocol during tumour board runtime and integrated in the hospital provided documentation system (MEDOCS + ). This consensus is elaborated either by using the best recent evidence of treatment option or by presenting the patient to a randomised controlled clinical trial.

Results. Between 11=2005 and 11=2007 446 consultations of 402 cases were presented mainly by the surgeon in the weekly tumour board. A mean number of seven patients, which can be handled effectively in one hour, were discussed per board session. Eighty four percent of the patients had a curative oncological treatment concept. Eighteen percent had neoadjuvant treatment and 66% were scheduled for primary operation. Sixteen percent received no treatment or best supportive care.

Conclusions. The establishment of a weekly tumour board is easily possible by help of a jour-fixe-schedule. The compositions of the patient cohort as well as all decisions ever made to a particular patient are transparent at all times. This means more treatment safety for the patient and the treating physicians as well. Background. The purpose of this study was to evaluate the midterm results of a new combined surgical and endovascular technique for the treatment of thoracic aortic aneurysms and dissections.

Methods. Between August 2005 and December 2007, twelve patients (53.6 AE 14.8 years; 8 male, 4 female) with aortic pathologies (7 dissections, 5 aneurysms) underwent replacement of the ascending aorta and the aortic arch, and simultaneous stent graft implantation into the descending aorta. Size dynamics of the false lumen and aneurysm sac were analyzed on the basis of the maximum dimension of the excluded aneurysmal space and the maximum aortic diameter obtained on computed tomography before hospital discharge and every six months thereafter.

Results. The technical success rate was 100%. All patients survived during the follow-up period, but one patient suffered from postoperative stroke. The follow up period ranged from 1 to 18 months. There were no instances of aneurysma sac rupture during the follow-up period. Postoperative computed tomography scans showed complete thrombosis of the aneurysm or dissection within the entire zone of the stentgraft placement.

Conclusions. The combined surgical and endovascular technique described in this report proved effective for the treatment of extended aortic lesions. The perigraft space thrombosed completely within the zone of the stentgraft. Background. The aim of the study was to determine late vascular events in patients after endovascular stent-graft placement of thoracic aortic diseases.

Methods. From 1996 through 2007 a total of 174 patients (mean age 67a) underwent endovascular stent-graft placement of thoracic aortic diseases at our institution. Indications were aneurysms (n ¼ 87), acute and chronic type B dissections (n ¼ 42), penetrating ulcers (n ¼ 33) and traumatic transsections (n ¼ 12).
Results. During a median follow-up of 42 months (1-108 months), in 21% of patients, late vascular events were observed.

The highest incidence was observed in patients after stent-graft placement for type B dissections (29%), closely followed by patients after stent-graft placement for penetrating ulcers (24%). The incidence after stent-graft placement for aneurysms was 18%. No events were observed in patients after traumatic transsections. Interestingly, patients undergoing stent-graft placement due to dilatative arteriopathy developed further dilatations in other regions and patients undergoing stent-graft placement due to obliterative arteriopathy were more prone to sustain obliterative diseases in other vascular beds.

Conclusions. This study clearly outlines the necessity of a close follow-up in these patients, not only to assess long-term outcome of endovascular stent-graft placement, but also to monitor these patients for new vascular pathologies.

A novel approach to the disease mechanism and to the treatment algorithm of intramural hematomas affecting the entire thoracic aorta Background. To reevaluate the disease mechanism and the treatment algorithm of intramural hematomas affecting the entire thoracic aorta.

Methods. Within a two-year period, we treated seven patients with this pathology by endovascular stent-graft placement. In all patients a small atherosclerotic plaque at the lateral wall or at the concavity of the aortic arch could be identified as the underlying cause of the disease. One patient required extension of the proximal landing zone by autologous double transposition prior to stent-graft placement.

Results. Endovascular stent-graft placement were performed successfully in all patients. By covering the suspected primary lesion, resorption of the intramural hematoma of the entire thoracic aorta could be achieved in all patients. Mean follow-up is 16 months (4-25 months) .

Conclusions. By careful diagnostic evaluation, a small atherosclerotic plaque at the lateral wall or at the concavity of the distal aortic arch may be identified as the underlying cause in many cases of intramural hematomas affecting the entire thoracic aorta. Thereby an endovascular approach may be equally effective as conventional ascending and hemiarch replacement. Background. To determine mid-term durability of endovascular stent-graft placement in patients with perforating athero-sclerotic ulcers (PAU) involving the thoracic aorta and to identify risk factors for death as well as early and late cardiovascular events.

Methods. From 1997 through 2006, 27 patients (mean age 66 yrs) presented with PAU (rupture n ¼ 7). Mean numeric Euro-SCORE was 11 and mean logistic EuroSCORE was 35. Median follow-up was 42 (10-86) months, being complete in all patients. Outcome variables included death and occurence of early and late cardiovascular events.

Results. In-hospital mortality was 11%. Primary success rate was 100%. Actuarial survival rates at 1, 3 and 5 years were 93%, 78% and 70%, respectively. Hemodynamic instability (OR 2.5; p ¼ 0.034) as well as logistic EuroSCORE (OR 2.8; p ¼ 0.019) were identified as independent predictors of early and late cardiovascular events.

Conclusions. Endovascular stent-graft placement in patients with PAU is an effective palliation for a life-threatening sign of a severe systemic process. Hemodynamic instability at referral and a high preoperative risk score predict adverse outcome. During mid-term follow-up, patients are mainly limited by sequelae of their underlying disease.

Bilirubin suppresses activation of mitogen activated protein kinases associated with ischemia and reperfusion injury Background. Induction of HO-1 has been shown to effectively ameliorate ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI). HO-1 degrades heme into carbon monoxide (CO), free iron and biliverdin. Biliverdin is subsequently converted to bilirubin. Accumulating evidence now suggests that bilirubin may account for the beneficial effects of HO-1. Aim of this study was to determine whether administration of bilirubin has beneficial effects on IRI by measuring mitogen activated protein kinase (MAPK) activation.

Methods. Isogenic C57Bl=6 hearts (n ¼ 4=group) were transplanted heterotopically after 18 h of cold ischemia. Bilirubin was administered either by rinsing the graft (125 mM) or i.v. injections to the donor and=or the recipient at 17.5 mg=kg. Grafts were harvested 15 min after reperfusion. Lysates were probed for the total (T) and the phosphorylated (P) forms of ERK 1=2, JNK 1=2 and p38-MAPK. P=T ratio was quantified by ImageJ software and statistically analyzed using ANOVA.

Results. Phosphorylation of ERK and p38-MAPK was increased after 18 h of ischemia (prior to reperfusion) when compared to non ischemic hearts. This was not seen in any of the bilirubin treated groups. At 15 min after reperfusion, activation of all MAPKs was observed. At this time point, bilirubin treatment caused a significant inhibition of ERK and JNK (p < 0.001) as well as p38-MAPK (p < 0.05) phosphorylation.

Conclusions. Bilirubin treatment inhibits MAPK activation what may account for the protective effects in IRI. Bilirubin treatment may be a promising strategy to improve outcome after solid organ transplantation. Background. Prognosis of ischemic heart failure is poor and therapeutic options are limited. Shock wave therapy (SWT) reportedly induces VEGF overexpression in ischemic skin flaps and ischemic myocardium. Here, we hypothesized that epicardial SWT improves ventricular function by enhancing angiogenesis in an experimental model of ischemic heart failure in rats.

Methods. Adult Sprague Dawley rats were subdivided in 3 groups: sham-operated (sham), infarcted myocardium with epicardial SWT (SWT group) and infarcted myocardium without epicardial SWT (control). Four weeks following myocardial infarction (MI), epicardial SWT (100 impulses at 0.15 mJ=m 2 ) was applied directly to the infarcted region in the SWT-group, control animals were untreated. Cardiac function was evaluated using echocardiography before MI, 4 weeks after MI and 12 weeks after SWT. Angiogenesis was evaluated 12 weeks after treatment in serial sections stained with von Willebrand Factor antibody, which were digitalized and morphometried.

Results. As compared to sham group (50 AE 4%), left ventricular function decreased in the SWT (21 AE 9%, p < 0.001) and control (18 AE 4%, p < 0.001) group 4 weeks after MI. Fourteen weeks after epicardial SWT, left ventricular function improved in the SWT-group as compared to 4 weeks after MI (37 AE 8%, p ¼ 0.021) and as compared to the controls (21 AE 4%, p < 0.001). Quantitative histology revealed more vital cells (384 AE 84 cells= field in SWT vs 288 AE 56 in controls, p ¼ 0.02) and enhanced angiogenesis (7.1 AE 3.3 vessels=field in SWT vs 3.2 AE 1.8 in controls, p ¼ 0.016) in the SWT group.
Conclusions. Direct epicardial shock wave therapy improves left ventricular function and induces neoangiogenesis an experimental model of ischemic heart failure in rats.

Epicardial shock wave therapy induces neoangiogenesis and improves left ventricular function after myocardial infarction in pigs in vivo Background. Therapeutic options of ischemic heart failure are limited. Shock wave therapy (SWT) reportedly induces VEGF overexpression in ischemic myocardium. We hypothesized that epicardial SWT improves ventricular function in an experimental model of ischemic heart failure by inducing neoangiogenesis.

Methods. Pigs were subdivided in 3 groups: unharmed myocardium with epicardial SWT (healthy control, n ¼ 2), infarcted myocardium with epicardial SWT (SWT-group, n ¼ 6) and infarcted myocardium without epicardial SWT (control, n ¼ 2). Four weeks following myocardial infarction (MI), epicardial SWT (300 impulses at 0.15 mJ=m 2 ) was applied directly to the infarcted area in the healthy control and the SWT-group, controls were left untreated. Cardiac function was evaluated using echocardiography before MI, 4 weeks after MI and 4 weeks after SWT. Angiogenesis was evaluated 4 weeks after treatment by immunohistology with vonWillebrand Factor antibody, which was morphometried with Lucia software.

Results. Compared to healthy controls (68 AE 0.7%), left ventricular ejection fraction decreased in the SWT (43 AE 2.5%, p < 0.001) and control group (41 AE 4.2%, p ¼ 0.012) 4 weeks after MI. After epicardial SWT, ejection fraction improved in the SWTgroup as compared to 4 weeks after MI (62 AE 9.1%, p ¼ 0.006), no improvement was observed in the control group (46 AE 5%, p ¼ 0.126). As compared to healthy controls (69 AE 1.4%) ejection fraction normalized in the SWT-group 4 weeks after SWT (p ¼ 0.358), it remained decreased in the control group (p ¼ 0.031). No adverse effects were observed.

Conclusions. Epicardial SWT improves left ventricular function after myocardial infarction in pigs. It therefore seems to be an effective and safe therapeutic strategy for the treatment of ischemic heart disease.

Does the application of electrical microcurrent heal heart failure by down regulation of the pro-inflammatory cytokines? First pre-clinical in vivo results Unloading of hearts by cardiac assist devices leads to improvement of the hearts function to variable extent. Improvement fails if the extracellular matrix (ECM) shows pronounced remodelling. We investigated the effect of electrical microcurrent (MC) on healing of heart failure with partcular focus of the ECM in in-vivo examinations using spontaniously hypertensive rats (SHR).

Two patch electrodes were placed around the hearts of SHR. MC was applied for 5 days. Thereafter, parameter of the ECM of the myocardium was analysed and compared to the myocardium from wild type rats (WKY) and SHR without previous MC application. Gene expression (quantitative PCR) was measured for MMP 2, 3, 8, 9, 13, 14, 16; TIMP 1, 2, 3, 4; connexin 40, 43, 45 and collagen I and III and eventually the level of IL-6.

Compared to the myocardium of WKY, the myocardium of SHR without MC application showed a significantly higher level of MMP 3, significant lower level of MMP 8, 14, 16 and an unchanged level of MMP 2 and 13. The TIMPs and connexins were only marginally altered. Collagen I showed an upregulation of 40%.

After MC application, MMP 2, 3, 9, 13, 14 and 16 were significantly up-regulated, MMP 8 remained unchanged, and most importantly, collagen I up-regulated by a factor of 2.5. All other analysed parameters were not altered by MC application. The gene expression level of IL-6 was significantly downregulated.

MC application regulates MMPs and collagen I on the gene level and normalizes the ECM of hearts in failure. IL-6 was significantly downregulated. MC application initializes a process towards healing of the diseased myocardium.

Lipocalin-2, a promising inflammatory marker in acute allograft rejection? Background. Lipocalin-2 (Lcn-2) is associated with ische-mia=reperfusion injury (IRI) in different organs. Data on Lcn-2 expression during allograft rejection have been missing so far. The main focus of this study was to analyze the possible implication of Lcn-2 during acute rejection following solid organ transplantation.

Methods. We investigated the expression of Lcn-2 in two different settings: (1) Hearts from male inbred C3H mice were transplanted into C57BL=6 wildtype and Lcn-2 -=recipients. Hearts were recovered at different time points (0 min, 2, 4, 6 and 8d) and Lcn-2 expression was analyzed by conventional histology, Western blot and immunohistochemistry.

(2) Serum of 40 patients undergoing orthotopic liver transplantation was collected preoperatively and postoperatively from day 1 to 15. Lcn-2 was analyzed by ELISA and expression levels were correlated with parameters of allograft rejection.
Results.

(1) Lcn-2 expression already increased in early stages of acute rejection (2d) and significantly correlated with the amount of infiltrating polymorphonuclear cells. Coincidental expression of migration molecules like MIP2 or MMP-9 with Lcn-2 upregulation was observed. (2) Serum levels of NGAL following liver transplantation were elevated 3-7-fold immediately after transplantation due to IRI and also increased prior to clinically apparent acute rejection closely related to elevated laboratory parameters.

Conclusions. Our data suggest a chemoattractant function of Lcn-2 in the allograft due to infiltrating immune competent cells. Lcn-2 is an inflammatory marker upregulated during acute graft rejection and its expression prior to clinical parameters of acute rejection might help to identify possible targets for therapeutic intervention. Gemeinsam wurden in den letzten 5 Jahren über 750 Tumorpatienten betreut und über 1500 Therapieregime festgelegt. Neben der operativen Behandlung erfolgt auch die weitere Therapie an der Chirurgischen Abteilung. Das Spektrum reicht von neoadjuvanter Radio-Chemotherapie bis hin zu Zytostatikatherapien und Behandlungen mit Biologicals. Background. Sentinel lymph node (SLN) mapping with radioisotope and blue dye has been advocated for the staging of breast cancer. Both techniques have limitations and this study was performed to evaluate the feasibility of fluorescence detection of SLN using ICG.

Methods. Thirty patients with breast cancer who underwent planned axillary lymph node dissection were included in the study. All patients received an injection of 5-25 mg Indocyanine green (ICG) for intraooperative fluorescence detection of the SLN. Aditionally, 20 patients received 99-sulfur technetium radiocolloid for intraoperative gamma probe scanning. Detection rate, sensitivity and specificty of both methods were endpoints of the study.

Results. Overall ICG fluorescence imaging identified at least one SLN in 29 of 30 patients (detection rate: 97%). Metastatic involvement of the SLN was found in 19 of 21 patients with positive lymph nodes (sensitivity: 90.4%). There was only one false negative case in 21 patients (4.7%). In a group of 20 patients ICG fluorescence imaging was compared with intraoperative gammaprobe detection after radiocolloid injection and SLNs were identified in 20 and 17 patients, respectively. Metastatic lymph nodes correctly diagnosed in 12 of 13 patients by ICG and in 10 of 11 patients by isotope (sensitivity: 91% vs. 92%). The false negative rate was 7.6% and 9.0%, respectively.

Conclusions. ICG fluorescence imaging allows intraoperative transcutaneous imaging of lymphatic vessels and SLN detection and may be become a valuable alternative to conventional detection methods such as gamma probe detection and blue dye staining. Background. The primary goal of surveillance colonoscopy after resection of colorectal cancer (CRC) is the detection of metachronous neoplasms. The calculated annual incidence for metachronous CRC is 0.35% per year. Identifying patients at risk of developing a metachronous CRC has important implications in their management but remains problematic. Because of greater incidence of microsatellite instability (MSI) in metachronous CRC than in single CRC, MSI might be helpful in predicting the development of metachronous CRC.

Methods. This study has examined the value of MSI analysis in identifying patients at risk of developing metachronous cancer after resection of CRC. In 395 patients with stage-III colon cancer participating in a prospective randomized trial microsatellite instability was evaluated using five polymorphic markers. Surveillance colonoscopy was performed every six month for the first five years, and then once a year. The median follow-up time was 84.3 months.

Results. Thirty patients had microsatellite instable (MSI) tumors and one of them (1=30; 3.3%) developed a metachronous colorectal cancer six months after primary resection. Microsatellite stable (MSS) tumors were found in 365 patients. 5 patients (5=365; 1.4%) with MSS primary tumors developed a metachronous colorectal cancer (CRC) after a median interval of 44 months.

Conclusions. Microsatellite instability does not identify patients at risk of developing a metachronous CRC, although the interval between primary and metachronous CRC seems to be shorter. Background. Locally advanced intraperitoneal tumors with serosal invasion and localized peritumor peritoneal implants will lead to diffuse peritoneal carcinomatosis in 30-60% of patients despite extensive surgery and adjuvant systemic chemotherapy.

Methods. At our institution 202 patients with peritoneal carcinomatosis of different origin have been treated by extensive surgery and intraoperative intraperitoneal hyperthermic chemoperfusion (IHCP) between 1993 and 7=2006. Within this cohort there are 13 patients (mean age: 49 yrs, 21-66) with localized peritoneal carcinomatosis. Primary tumors were: colon=5, appendix=4, stomach=1, small bowel=1, ovary and uterus=2. In all these patients, the primary tumor was removed according to standard oncological criteria, the localized peritoneal seedings removed by partial peritonectomy, omentectomy and bilateral oophorectomy (in premenopausal women) were added. IHCP was performed at 41-42 C using Mitomycin C as chemotherapeutic agent.

Results. The mean observation time is 89.5 months (AE30.2; 95%CI). All patients have survived (min -max: 18-166 months). 1 relapsed after 9 years and was treated a second time by peritonectomy and IHCP. Two patients developed extraperitoneal metastasis and are on systemic chemotherapy.
Conclusions. IHCP combined with radical surgery seems to prevent the onset of diffuse peritoneal carcinomatosis. These findings are the basis of an ongoing phase II trial.

Is the prognostic significance of lymphatic and venous invasion in colorectal cancer related to vessel location? Background. To assess the prognostic impact of intra-and=or extramural lymphatic and=or venous invasion in colorectal cancer (CRC).

Methods. The slides of 381 randomly selected CRCs were reevaluated with respect to tumour stage and grade and presence of intra-and=or extramural lymphatic and=or venous invasion. Data were correlated with outcome in both uni-and multivariate analysis.

Results. Lymphatic and venous invasion was observed in 126=381 (33%) and 87=381 (23%) patients and was significantly associated with tumour stage (p < 0.001) and grade (p < 0.001). Intramural (L1a), extramural (L1b) as well as both intra-and extramural lymphatic invasion (L1ab) was seen in 44%, 6% and 50% of cases. Intramural (V1a), extramural (V1b) as well as both intra-and extramural venous invasion (V1ab) was seen in 16%, 62% and 22% of cases. Regarding progression-free survival, venous and lymphatic invasion proved prognostic significance in both univariate (p < 0.001) and multivariate (p < 0.001) analysis. In addition, extramural lymphatic invasion (compared with intramural invasion) proved to be a significant prognosticator in univariate (p < 0.001) and multivariate (p ¼ 0.01) analysis, whereas presence of extramural venous invasion (compared with intramural invasion) demonstrated prognostic significance only in univariate analysis (p ¼ 0.02).

Conclusions. Patient outcome was significantly associated with presence of angioinvasion. Moreover, extramural lymphatic permeation proved to be a new independent prognostic variable (compared with intramural lymphatic permeation) and should Background. Several studies have shown, that improved local tumor staging by preoperative MRI leads to a change of surgical management in up to 35% of patients. There is also growing evidence, that the influence of preoperative MRI on surgical therapy can reduce local recurrence rate. In this study we analysed the benefit of preoperative MR-Imaging regarding surgical treatment, local recurrence rate and survival after more than five years of follow up.

Methods. The retrospectice study (n ¼ 270) includes all female patients with histologically verified invasive breast carcinoma, which have been operated at our department between 1995 and 2002. Exclusion criteria were carcinoma in situ, local recurrence, inflammatory carcinoma and neoadjuvant therapy. Demographic, radiological, operative and histological data, standardized follow up (DFS, OS) and recurrence rate were analysed.

Results. The additional preoperative MRI findings (30% multifocal or multicentric tumor manifestations) changed the surgical management from tumorectomy to mastectomy in 15% of patients. The rate of local recurrence in the Non-MRI-group and in the MRI-group was 5.5% and 3.3%, respectively. The disease free survival was 60 months in the Non-MRI-group and 66 months in the MRI-group (mean follow up 75 months) (p ¼ 0.160).

Conclusions. The identification of multifocal or multicentric tumor manifestations by MRI is essential for the appropriate planning of the surgical therapy. The data show for the first time, that MRI improves not only local recurrence rate, but also disease free survival in patients with breast cancer.

Einfluss der Anastomoseninsuffizienz auf die onkologischen Langzeitergebnisse nach Rektumkarzinomresektion Grundlagen. Die Anastomoseninsuffizienz beeinflusst wesentlich die Morbidität und Letalität in der Rektumkarzinomchirurgie. Die Relevanz hinsichtlich der onkologischen Langzeitergebnisse wird in der Literatur kontrovers diskutiert. Basierend auf den Daten einer multizentrischen prospektiven Beobachtungsstudie wird der Einfluss der Anastomoseninsuf-fizienz auf das onkologische Outcome an einem großen Patientenkollektiv analysiert.

Methodik. Zwischen 01=2000 bis 12=2001 kurativ resezierte Patienten mit einem Rektumkarzinom bis 12 cm über der Ano-Cutan-Linie in den UICC-Stadien I-III und regelrechter Anastomosenheilung (Gruppe I, n ¼ 1741) wurden Patienten mit postoperativer, nicht operationspflichtiger Insuffizienz (Gruppe II, n ¼ 146) und Patienten mit operationspflichtiger Insuffizienz (Gruppe III, n ¼ 157) gegenübergestellt und hinsichtlich demographischer und behandlungsspezifischer Parameter sowie der onkologischen Langzeitergebnisse (5-Jahres-Lokalrezidivrate, tumorfreies Ü berleben) verglichen.

Ergebnisse. Patienten mit postoperativer Anastomoseninsuffizienz zeigten eine signifikant höhere postoperative Letalität im Vergleich zu Patienten mit unauffälliger Anastomosenheilung (4,3% vs. 1,2%, P < 0,001). Bei einem medianen Follow-up von 40 Monaten und einer Follow-up-Rate von 80% (n ¼ 1625=2044) konnte nur fü r die operationspflichtige Anastomoseninsuffizienz ein signifikanter Anstieg der 5-Jahres-Lokalrezidivrate (17,5%; p ¼ 0,023) und eine geringere tumorfreie 5-Jahres-Ü berlebensrate (70,9%; p ¼ 0,020) im Vergleich zu Patienten ohne Anastomoseninsuffizienz (10,1% resp. 75,4%) ermittelt werden. Die Ergebnisse der Patienten mit nicht-operationspflichtiger Insuffizienz waren mit denen der Patienten ohne Insuffizienz vergleichbar.

Schlussfolgerungen. Das Auftreten einer Anastomoseninsuffizienz nach Kontinuitäts-resektion des Rektumkarzinoms ist mit einem signifikant schlechteren früh-postoperativen Outcome assoziiert. Ein negativer prognostischer Einfluss der Anastomoseninsuffizienz hinsichtlich des Auftretens eines lokalen Tumorrezidivs sowie des tumorfreien Ü berlebens war nur für Patienten mit operationspflichtiger Insuffizienz nachzuweisen.

Chirurgisches Management bronchobiliärer Fisteln nach perkutaner Thermofrequenzablation Grundlagen. Sepsis und ihre Folgen sind heutzutage die häufigste Todesursache auf einer Intensivstation. Im Schnitt werden 20%-50% aller Kosten auf einer Intensivstation für die Behandlung der Sepsis aufgewandt. Es ist daher verständlich, dass bei der hohen Letalität und der immensen Kosten, Anstrengungen unternommen werden, die Sepsis frühzeitig zu erkennen, um sie adäquat zu behandeln. Es ist mittlerweile klar, dass die Sepsisbehandlung eine interdisziplinäre Aufgabe für Intensivmediziner, Chirurgen, Radiologen und Mikrobiologen ist. Voraussetzung aber ist es, eine gemeinsame Sprache zu sprechen. Ziel ist es daher, Definitionen und Klassifikationen und ihre Bedeutung für die tägliche Arbeit zu benennen.

Definitionen. Eine intraabdominelle Infektion ist eine bakterielle Entzü ndung des viszeralen und parietalen Peritoneums und der angrenzenden Organe. Unter einer Peritonitis hingegen versteht man eine Entzü ndung des Peritoneums, die sowohl bakteriell als auch chemisch sein kann. In der täglichen Praxis aber, wird diese Unterscheidung selten gemacht. Ü blicherweise kann die Erkrankung von einer abakteriellen zu einer bakteriellen fortschreiten.

Klassifikation. Die Peritonitis kann auf vielfache Weise eingeteilt werden: nach der Ausbreitung (lokal, diffus), nach dem vorherrschenden Sekret (phänomenologisch -fibrinös, eitrig, kotig, gallig) und nach der Pathogenese (primär, sekundär, tertiär). Chirurgen behandeln hauptsächlich sekundäre Peritonitiden (nach Perforation eines Hohlorganes).

Scoring systeme. Die häufigsten Scoring Systeme sind der Mannheimer Peritonitis Index (MPI), der Multiple Organ Dysfunction Score (MODS), der Sepsis related Organ Function Score (SOFA), der Peritonitis Severity Score (PSS) und der Acute Physiology and Chronic Health (APACHE II) Score. Scoring Systeme sind wichtig, um die Prognose des schwerkranken Patienten abzuschätzen.
Zusammenfassung. Am häufigsten werden der MPI und der APACHE II Score verwendet, die beide als gleichwertig anzusehen sind, während der Letztere jedoch aufwendiger ist.
Chirurgische Therapie und Ergebnisse beim perforierten Ulcus des oberen Gastrointestinaltraktes

A new transoral gastroplasty device for GERD and obesity Background. Gastroesophageal reflux disease and morbid obesity are significant health problems associated with increasing costs. The common surgical therapy is either a laparoscopic or open operation. We are developing a device for endoscopic, fullthickness gastroplasty; the primary goals being reducing the diameter of the gastroesophageal junction (GERD) or the stomach volume (obesity).

Methods. The gastroplasty is formed by a new device (Safe-sStitch Medical Inc.) that consists of a flexible tube with an integrated distal excision and suture capsule containing a guillotine excision blade, vertical injection needles and two needles each connected to a suture. A transnasal endoscope is introduced through the device for visualization. Four full-thickness sutures and two mucosal excisions are used for each stage of the gastroplasty. After correct positioning the gastric wall is sucked into the trough and two three-quarter-circle needles rotate 360˚through the captured tissue. To assure the correct cutting depth and haemostasis we inject an adrenaline solution. The second suture-excision-cycle is performed by turning the device and repeating the sequence. The sutures are transoraly tied resulting in a full-thickness muscularis-propria-tomuscularis-propria apposition.

Results. We performed pre clinical procedures with ex vivo porcine (n ¼ 45) and human tissue (n ¼ 10) as well as in vivo porcine (n ¼ 5) and canine procedures (n ¼ 5). In each model we were able to create full-thickness gastroplasties. The GEJ circumference changes and the obesity gastroplasty outlet were measured endoscopically.

Pre-clinical work has demonstrated the feasibility of the device and its procedures. Two survival canine studies are in progress and will direct further evolution. Grundlagen. Die asymptomatische Trägerin eines in den Choledochus migrierten Titan-Clip nach laparoskopischer Cholecystektomie gab Anlaß Physiopathologie, Therapieoptionen sowie Vermeidungsstrategien dieser Komplikation sowohl der konventionellen als auch der minimal invasiven Chirurgie zu untersuchen.

Methodik. 1. case report: Geschildert wird der Fall einer 69jährigen Patientin, die wegen eines Dünndarm-Adhäsionsileus in unserer Abteilung behandelt wurde bei anamnestisch bekannter stattgehabter laparoskopischer Cholecystektomie 15 Jahre zuvor. In der CT-gestützten Diagnostik wurde der asymptomatische intraductale Clip detektiert. In der Folge wurde dieser per ERCP extrahiert.

2. In einer ,,pub-med''-Recherche zu den Schlüsselwörtern ,,clip, migration, choledochus, thread material'' bis zum Jahre 1975 wurde die Literatur zum Thema der Clip-migration und des Kristallisationspotentiales intracholedochaler Fremdkörper, die sich nach GARCIA (1983) in iatrogenen, ingestiven und penetrierenden Ursprunges unterteilen lassen, bezüglich der klinisch relevanten Größen Physiopathologie, Therapieoptionen und Vermeidungsstrategien gesichtet.

Ergebnisse. Die Migration von Clips stellt keine spezifische Komplikation der minimal invasiven Chirurgie dar.
