Aufbauend auf den Beobachtungen und Erfahrungen aus der konventionellen Galle-Chirurgie, insbesondere bezüglich der durch Nahmaterial verschiedenster Qualität gestörten Metastabilität der Galleflüssigkeit, und unter Darstellung weiterer intraduktaler Pathologien des Choledochus werden mögliche physiopathologisch favorisierende Faktoren, die sich aus dem konventionellen oder minimal invasiven Operationsduktus ergeben, erörtert. In der Folge werden Therapienotwendigkeit und -optionen, letztere vor allem im Sinne endoskopischer Prozeduren, auch asymptomatischer intracholedochaler Nidus sowie mögliche intraoperative Vorsichtsmaßnahmen zur Vermeidung des Phänomens der Clip-wanderung besprochen.

Schlussfolgerungen. Die Autoren schließen, dass dieses seltene Ereignis im Dekurs kompliziert verlaufender laparoskopischer Cholecystektomien differentialdiagnostisch in Betracht gezogen werden muß und unterstreichen die präponderante Rolle der therapeutischen Endoskopie. Background. Training and certification of aspiring laparoscopic surgeons by use of computed or mechanical simulation and animal models is highly demanded to improve the procedural safety in minimally invasive surgery. A standardized minimal invasive surgery curriculum at the Medical University of Innsbruck (Training Center for Minimally Invasive Surgery) is introduced.

Methods. In 12=2007 we implemented a laparoscopic educational program for surgical trainees comprising a three step hands-on workshop: Virtual reality training by use of the haptic version LapSim (Surgicalscience) allows to improve basal technical skills and coordination whereas entire surgical procedures can be mimmicked using a video box trainer (Tübinger Trainer, Wolf). Thirdly, in vivo trocar placement and dissection of vital organs can be trained in an porcine model in the animal lab. Having passed a test on the virtual reality simulator trainees are asked to assist at basic and advanced laparoscopic procedures to become certified.

Results. The certification level is defined according to the validated protocols on the virtual reality simulator: Residents start by pointing at balls with the instruments but end up with laparoscopic suturing, clip applying or use of diathermy and ultrasonic instruments. In the wet-lab each trainee has to perform a lap-cholecystectomy and closure of a gastric perforation whereas the laparoscopic team performance is assessed in the animal model demonstrating basic laparoscopic procedures (cholecystectomy, splenectomy, and suturing).

Conclusions. The laparoscopic educational curriculum is designed to enable laparoscopic training and skill transfer from virtual reality into the operation room. Grundlagen. Korrekturoperationen bei Trichterbrust zeigten in den letzten 10 Jahren einen deutlichen Aufwärtstrend was vor allem durch die ,,Nussoperation'' und deren mittlerweile zahlreichen Modifikationen zurückzuführen ist.
Methodik. An unserer Abteilung wurden seit dem Jahre 2000 insgesamt 25 Patienten (23 Knaben 3 Mädchen) mit einer Trichterbrust nach Nuss operiert.

Ergebnisse. Das durchschnittliche Alter lag bei 10,4 Jahren. Die Entlassung der Patienten erfolgte durchschnittlich am 9 postoperativen Tag wobei die Spanne zwischen 4 und 44 Tagen lag. Auffallend war hier eine deutliche Korrelation zwischen Patientenalter und Entlassungstag. Je jünger die Patienten desto früher konnten sie entlassen werden. Auch bei der postoperativen Schmerztherapie fiel auf, dass jüngere Patienten deutlich weniger Schmermittel benötigten als Ä ltere und deren Aufenthaltsdauer an der Kinderintensivstation kürzer war. Die Komplikationsrate war auch umso niedriger je jünger der Patient war. All dies veranlasste uns das Indikationsalter der Patienten zu senken. So wurden an unserer Abteilung im vergangenen Jahr unter anderem 2 Patienten operiert deren Alter zum Operationstag bei 2 bzw. 4 Jahren lag. Bei dem 2-jährigen Mädchen wurde bei der Geburt eine CCAM im EXIT-Verfahren operiert. Beide Verläufe waren komplikationslos und durch geringeren Schmerzmittelbedarf charakterisiert.

Schlussfolgerungenen. Die Korrekturoperation nach Nuss ist durchaus eine Operation die im Kleinkinderalter durchgeführt werden kann. Man soll bei der Diagnose Trichterbrust früh agieren sprich operieren und nicht erst im Erwachsenenalter reagieren um die Komplikationsrate zu minimieren.

Prospektive Analyse von Frühkomplikationen bei minimal invasiver Trichterbrustkorrektur (Nuss-Methode) Background. We report our experiences using the modified minimal invasive method of pectus excavatum repair according to Nuss enriched by thoracoscopic chondrotomy.
Patients. Eleven Patients with a mean age of 16.5 AE 2.5 years have been operated using this modification within the last year.

Methods. In addition to the Nuss procedure thoracoscopic chondrotomies of the ribs using the lateral incision were performed. The cartilaginous part of the ribs in the area of the funnel was dissected using endoscopic kauterisation. In eight patients an additional oblique wedge shaped partial sternal osteotomy was necessary to reduce physical load and ease the elevation of the sternum. Retrosternal mobilization and introperative stretching of the thorax using a ''rochard-bar'' also modified the operation technique. In three of the eleven patients one Pectus bars with integrated stabiliser plates (PS-Implant + , Fa. Hofer Austria) was implanted, eight patients needed two Pectus bars to minimize the retrosternal pressure.

Results. Due to preparation we had one intraoperative bleeding episode of the internal mammaric vessel, one patient developed an extrathoracal haematoma which required surgical intervention. The Vertebral index changed from 34.5 AE 5.9 preoperatively to 23.3 AE 4.3 postoperatively. The cosmetic results in all eleven patients were good to excellent.

Conclusions. Thoracoscopic chondrotomies of the ribs even when combined with partial osteotomy of the sternum do not destabilize the chest. Using the described modified extended procedure reduces the retrosternal physical load and makes a postoperative excellent cosmetic result possible also in patients with a deep funnel chest and a stiff thorax. Methodik. Wir präsentieren eine prospektive Studie, die an SHT Patienten. mit entsprechender klinischer Symptomatik (u.a. Bewusstlosigkeit, Erbrechen, retrograde Amnesie) durchgeführt wurde. Hierbei wurde aufgezeigt, in wieweit diagnostische bildgebende Verfahren mit S-100B Serumwerten korrelieren.

Ergebnisse. Die Studie umfasste ein Patientenkollektiv von 338 Patienten im Alter von 1=12 Jahre bis 18 Jahre, die im Zeitraum zwischen 12=04-10=07 mit der Diagnose SHT mit einem S100B Wert (<6 Stunden nach Trauma) stationär aufgenommen wurden. Ein CCT erhielten 99 (29,2%) Patienten von denen wiederum 43 (43,4%) eine Pathologie aufwiesen. Von diesen 43 Patienten hatten 42 eine Erhöhung des S100 Wertes über den Cutt-off Wert von 0,16 mg=L in Altersgruppe A (0-14a) und 0,105 in Gruppe B (>14-18a). Das ergab eine Sensitivität des S100B von 97% und eine Spezifität von 61% sowie einen positiven Vorhersagewert von 0,53 und einen negativen Vorhersagewert von 0,98.

Schlussfolgerungen. Aufgrund hoher Sensitivität und eines hohen negativen Vorhersagewertes des S100B kann die Einbeziehung der S-100B Messung in die klinische Evaluierung eine wesentliche Entscheidungshilfe bei der Indikationsstellung für ein CCT darstellen und in weiterer Folge die Anzahl an durchgeführten CCT's sowie die Aufenthaltsdauer im Krankenhaus wesentlich reduzieren. demanded repeated dilatations each 10-14 days. The strictures of esophagus had diameter 2-3 mm, length 4-8 cm. One patient had second stricture with non affected segment of 2 cm. Implantation of each stent was performed after previous dilatation with balloon to the Diameter of 10 mm. The implantation was performed in general anaesthesia, by means of guide wire and under endoscopic and X-ray control.

Results. In all four patients succeed the implantation without any problems. No migration or dislocation of the stent occurred during the stenting period. In one patient had a second, upper stricture which was treated with new implantation of the stent after one year. Three months after implantation no further dilatation was necessary in all patients. There after the interval of the dilatation increased to average two months in two patients, one month in the next one.

Conclusions. Biodegradabile stent prolonged the interval of the dilatation of the stricture of the esophagus in all four patients which was accompanied with increased quality of their life. In children could be the method useful to bridge gape to definitive esophagus reconstruction. Acute hematogenous osteomyelitis of pelvic bones of children is one of the most difficult to diagnose and insufficiently studied diseases.

We analyzed treatment of 18 children with acute hematogenous osteomyelitis (AHO) of pelvic bones treated in the City Children Clinical Hospital and the Regional Children Clinical Hospital during the last 5 years.
Among these patients hematogenous way of infection has been found in 11 children, and in 7 -disease developed as the result of injury of pelvic bones.

Insufficient knowledge of the clinic of AHO in children is the main cause of errors in the establishment of diagnosis. Diagnosis of AHO of pelvic bones often excluded due to the absence of changes in the roentgenogram of pelvic bones at early stages of the disease.

Osteoporosis develops at the 2-3 week of the disease. Periosteal reaction in proliferative phase is manifested non-uniformly. The patchy picture of the bone that noted in this phase, supplemented with the images of the regions of destruction of varying intensity, osteoporosis and sclerosis.

Lesion of joints is characterized by dilatation of joint spaces or their narrowing, obscurity of the articular surfaces, osteoporosis, and destruction around articular areas of the bone.Children with suspicion of AHO of pelvic bones must undergo USG, CT and=or MRT of the small pelvis bones and organs, which will permit to establish localization, dimensions of the inflammatory focus in pelvic bones and soft tissues at early stage provide opportunity to control effectiveness of treatment, predict the course and consequences of the disease.

Indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase and FoxP3 in infiltrating lymphocytes increase with time and severity of rejection in human hand transplantation Background. To better define the characteristics of infiltrating lymphozytes in skin rejection after human hand transplantation, skin biopsies were investigated for expression of FoxP3 and Indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase (IDO), a key regulatory enzyme to induce T-lymphocyte unresponsiveness.

Methods. One hundred and four skin biopsies taken from three bilateral hand transplant recipients during the first 6 years after transplantation were assessed by H & E histology (graded 0-4b) and immunohistochemistry for IDO and FoxP3. Levels of expression were assessed (0; þ; þþ; þ þ þ) and interpreted in the light of clinical courses, time after transplantation, severity of rejection and markers for lymphozyte migration.

Results. Rejection ranged between grade 0 and 4a with an average score of 0.94. IDO was found constitutively expressed in the endothelium independent of rejection. IDO expression in the cellular infiltrate was significantly increased upon and correlated well with severity of rejection ( Conclusions. Characteristics of the cellular infiltrate indicate a strong tendency towards self limitation of the alloimmune response towards the skin with both time after transplantation and severity of rejection in human hand transplantation. Background. Matrix Metalloproteinase 9 (MMP-9) is known to be involved in cell migration, tissue repair and remodelling. Lipocalin-2 (NGAL=Lcn-2) forms a complex with MMP-9 preventing it from degradation. Retrieved from previous data about the role of NGAL=Lcn-2 during ischemia and reperfusion (IR) following murine heart transplantation, this study focuses on the interaction between MMP-9 and NGAL=Lcn-2 in analogous settings.

Methods. Male inbred C57BL=6 and the Lcn-2 -=mouse were used for heterotopic heart transplantations. RT-PCR, Western blot, gelatine zymography and immunohistochemistry were performed to visualize MMP-9 and NGAL=Lcn-2 expression in the graft at different time points. Polymorphonuclear cells (PMN) isolated from wildtype and Lcn-2 -=mice were used for in vitro experiments.

Results. MMP-9 expression was upregulated 8 fold and peaked at 48 h compared to NGAL=Lcn-2 expression which peaked at 24 h. Similar expression patterns were observed in the different experimental settings (Lcn-2 -=donor Lcn-2 -=recipient, wildtype donor and recipient and mixed wildtype=Lcn-2 -=transplantations). However, MMP-9 protein levels were significantly lower in Lcn-2 -=grafts corresponding to a reduced infiltration of PMN in Lcn-2 -=recipients. In vitro PMN retrieved from Lcn-2 -=mice showed lower levels of MMP-9 than from wildtype mice. Stimulation of PMN with recombinant NGAL=Lcn-2 did not increase MMP-9 expression.

Conclusions. Our data demonstrate an interaction between MMP-9 and NGAL=Lcn-2 expression during IR in heart transplantation. Reduced MMP-9 expression in Lcn-2 -=grafts is directly related to the simultaneously decreased infiltration of PMN described previously, thus suggesting a chemotactic function of the MMP-9=Lcn-2 complex during IR of the transplanted heart.

Bilirubin and biliverdin ditaurate suppress renal ischemia reperfusion injury Background. Heme Oxygenase-1 (HO-1) is crucial in ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI). Biliverdin and bilirubin, products of heme catabolism, at least in part, account for the protective effects mediated by HO-1. We tested conjugated forms of bilirubin and biliverdin in a model of warm renal IRI and a model of kidney transplantation in rats.

Methods. Renal arteries of contralaterally nephrectomized Wistar rats were clamped for 45 min. Further, Wistar rat kidneys were transplanted after 18 h of cold ischemia into isogenic recipients. Animals were treated with saline or various doses of bilirubin or biliverdin ditaurate, applied as three i.v. injections covering the perioperative period or a single injection given either before or after reperfusion. Serum total bilirubin was assessed five minutes and serum urea and creatinine was assessed 24 h after reperfusion (n ¼ 4 in each group).

Results. An increase in serum total bilirubin before= during reperfusion caused by biliverdin or bilirubin treatment was associated with significantly lower serum creatinine and urea levels at 24 h after reperfusion in the clamp model when compared to the control (p < 0.05). However, when the bile pigments were applied post reperfusion, no effect on kidney function was being observed. In the transplant model, application of biliverdin ditaurate at 30 mg=kg but not at 3 or 10 mg=kg significantly improved kidney function when compared to the control (p < 0.05).
Conclusions. Intravenous application of water soluble bilirubin and biliverdin ditaurate prior to reperfusion is feasible and effective in improving kidney function after renal IRI.

Tetrahydrobiopterin attenuates renal ischemia reperfusion injury via maintenance of NO homeostasis and stress kinase inhibition Background. Tetrahydrobiopterin (BH4) is an essential cofactor for nitric oxide synthases (NOS) and thus a critical determinant of NO production. BH4 depletion during cold ischemia leads to uncoupling of NOS and contributes to reperfusion injury (IRI) due to increased superoxide formation. The role of BH4 during warm ischemia, however, is still largely unknown.

Methods. Ischemic renal injury was induced by clamping the left renal artery for 45 min in male Lewis-rats immediately after right-side nephrectomy. Reperfusion was studied at R0 (no reperfusion), 15 min (R1), 2 h (R2) and 7 days (R3). Animals received either BH4 (20 mg=kg=BW) prior to reperfusion (Group I) or saline (Group II). Sham operated animals served as controls. Renal function was determined by plasma creatinine= urea. BH4 tissue levels were assessed by HPLC. Morphologic changes were quantified by H & E histology. Peroxynitrite formation was assessed by nitrotyrosine-immunostaining and stress kinase (p38, JNK) activation was analysed using phosphorylation specific antibodies.

Results. BH4-tissue-levels were slightly increased after 45 min warm ischemia (1.0-1.6 fold) up to two days (R1, R2) when compared to non-ischemic controls. Additional BH4 treatment prior to ischemia significantly improved renal function at all time points studied following reperfusion (all p < 0.001). Furthermore, BH4 reduced ischemia induced histologic damage (increased inflammation, interstitial edema, hemorrhage, tubular atrophy and focal areas of necrosis) and diminished peroxynitrite formation and hence nitrotyrosine staining (R1-R3). Subsequently, stress kinase activation was abrogated following BH4 treatment further limiting ischemia reperfusion injury (p < 0.01).

Conclusions. BH4 treatment significantly improves post-ischemic renal function as well as histologic damage and might be a promising novel therapeutic strategy in attenuating IRI via maintenance of NO homeostasis and stress kinase inhibition in kidney transplantation.

Prevention of kidney ischemia-reperfusion (I=R)-associated injury: role of mitogen activated protein kinases Background. Ischemia (I) and reperfusion (R) trigger a series of events which culminate in severe injuries to the affected tissue in organ transplantation. Cell death, metabolic alterations and inflammation result in impairment of short-and long term function. Cells respond to extra cellular signals by transmitting intracellular instructions to coordinate appropriate responses. The group of mitogen activated protein kinases (MAPKs) was implicated through aberrant activation in many settings includingI= R-associated organ damage. Although MAPKs are known as critical proteins in cell signaling their role during I=R is controversially discussed.

Methods. To asses intracellular signaling and kidney function a rat ischemia reperfusion model was used. Ischemic renal injury was induced by clamping the left renal artery for 45 min in male Wistar-rats immediately after right-side nephrectomy. Reperfusion was studied at R0 (no reperfusion), 15 min (R1), 2 h (R2) and 7 days (R3). Sham-operated animals served as controls. Renal function was determined by plasma creatinine=urea. MAPKs (ERK, JNK, p38) activation was analysed using phosphorylation specific antibodies.

Results. In summary, reoxygenation was characterized by a dramatic increase in the activity of ERK (p < 0.05, JNK (p < 0.05) and p38 (p < 0.0001) during early reperfusion. This was associated with a significant raise in creatinine and urea. Data suggest that the use of small molecular weight p38-MAPK inhibitors (SB203580 and SB239063) have a beneficial effect on the ischemia reperfusion injury, showing a decrease in creatinine and urea as assessed 24 h after reperfusion.

Conclusions. Renal I=R injury is associated with a significant increase in MAPK activity. Isolated p38MAPK inhibition during ischemia improves kidney function suggesting that p38 may provide a promising target for ameliorating reperfusion injury.

NOS cofactor activity is essential for BH 4 associated attenuation of ischemia reperfusion injury following murine pancreas transplantation Tetrahydrobiopterin (BH 4 ) is not only an essential cofactor for nitric oxide synthases but also a strong antioxidant. This study compared the protective effect of BH 4 supplementation previous to organ retrieval with supplementation of 4-amino-tetrahydrobiopterin (ABH 4 ), a pteridin analogue with similar chemical redox behaviour but no cofactor activity.

Syngeneic C57BL6 mice were used as size-matched donorrecipient pairs. Cervical heterotopic vascularized pancreas transplantation was performed with a modified no-touch technique. Grafts were subjected to 16 h cold ischemia time (CIT) and different treatment regiments: untreated (I), BH 4 50 mg=kg i.m. (II) and ABH 4 50 mg=kg i.m. (III) both prior to organ retrieval. Non-transplanted animals served as controls (IV). After 2 h of reperfusion intravital fluorescence microscopy was used for analysis of graft microcirculation by means of functional capillary density (FCD). Parenchymal damage was quantified by histology (H&E) and by nitrotyrosine-immunostaining.

Following prolonged CIT only pancreatic grafts treated with BH 4 (II) displayed markedly higher values of FCD (I) (p < 0.01). In contrast, pre-treatment of donor animals with ABH 4 (III) did not improve FCD levels. Nevertheless, parenchymal damage as well as peroxynitrite formation were significantly attenuated in grafts of both treatment regiments (p < 0.05). However, acinar haemorrhage and fat necrosis as well as peroxynitrite formation were significantly reduced by BH 4 treatment compared to ABH 4 (p < 0.05).

The protective effect of BH 4 supplementation prior to organ retrieval relies on its NOS cofactor activity rather than on its antioxidative capacity. BH 4 might therefore be a novel promising agent to attenuate IRI in clinical solid organ transplantation.

Tetrahydrobiopterin supplementation prior to organ retrieval attenuates early parenchymal damage following murine pancreas transplantation Tetrahydrobiopterin (BH 4 ) is an essential cofactor for nitric oxide synthases and a critical determinant of NO production. BH 4 depletion contributes to ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI) after pancreas transplantation. Here we studied the therapeutic potential of donor BH 4 supplementation compared to recipient BH 4 treatment prior to reperfusion.

C57BL6 mice were used as size-matched donor-recipient pairs. Cervical heterotopic pancreas transplantation was performed with a modified no-touch technique. Grafts were subjected to 16 h cold ischemia time (CIT) and different treatment regiments: untreated (I), BH 4 50 mg=kg i.m. prior to organ reperfusion (II) and BH 4 50 mg=kg i.m. before organ retrieval (III). Non-transplanted animals served as controls (IV). 2 h after reperfusion intravital fluorescence microscopy was used for analysis of graft microcirculation by means of functional capillary density (FCD). Quantitative assessment of parenchymal damage was done by histology (H&E) and nitrotyrosine-immunostaining. BH 4 tissue levels were measured by HPLC.

Following prolonged CIT pancreatic grafts treated with BH 4 either before reperfusion (II) as well as prior to organ retrieval (III) displayed significantly higher values of FCD compared to non treated animals (I) (p < 0.01). BH 4 tissue levels were substantially increased in both BH 4 treated groups. Furthermore, parenchymal damage as well as peroxynitrite formation were significantly attenuated in both treatment regiments (p < 0.05). However, comparing groups II and III, donor pre-treatment showed significantly improved graft microcirculation and morphology compared to recipient supplementation prior to reperfusion (all p < 0.01).
Donor pre-treatment with BH 4 consistently reduces post-ischemic deterioration of the graft and might therefore be a promising novel strategy in attenuating IRI in pancreas transplantation.
ACE -Arbeitsgemeinschaft für Chirurgische Endokrinologie: Diagnose und Therapie der GEP=NET Tumore 2 227 Neuroendokrine Tumore des Magensist wirklich alles klar? J. Sauer, K. Dommisch

Grundlagen. Neuroendokrine Tumore sind seltene Erkrankungen des Magens, bei denen eine weniger radikale chirurgische Therapie oder eine endoskopische Therapie akzeptiert ist. Tumore bis 1 cm Größe bei gleichzeitig vorliegender Typ-A-Gastritis, MEN I oder Zollinger-Ellison-Syndrom werden endoskopisch abgetragen. Größere Tumore oder Tumore mit Infiltration der Lamina muscularis propria werden durch eine Magenteilresektion behandelt.
Methodik. Anhand eines aktuellen Falles und der Darstellung der Literatur wird die aktuelle Diagnostik-und Therapieempfehlung hinterfragt.

Ergebnisse. Bei unserer Patientin zeigte sich ein gemischtes exokrin-endokrines Karzinom, welches bei Einhalten der gültigen Empfehlungen für Diagnostik und Therapie nicht komplett entfernt worden wäre. Erst die Ausweitung der Therapie um eine Lymphadenektomie hat zur R0-Resektion geführt. Die Literatur zeigt ein uneinheitliches Bild.

Schlussfolgerungen. An Hand eines Fallberichtes und der Literatur werden die bisherige Therapieempfehlung kritisch hinterfragt und eine radikale chirurgische Therapie bei allen Karzinoiden über 1 cm Größe und bei neuroendokrinen Karzinomen gefordert. Die alleinige Magenteilresektion birgt die Gefahr des Residualtumors.

Immunhistochemischer Vergleich von Chromogranin A, B und Secretoneurin in neuroendokrinen Tumoren Background. The removal of the tumour and of all affected lymph nodes is the treatment of choice in NET cancer. In NET of the small bowel, the extent of intestinal resection is determined by number and distribution of metastasized nodes. So it is mandatory to remove as much of the mesentery as necessary, but as little as possible.

Methods. The 52 years old patient presented with small bowel obstruction due to repeated previous abdominal surgery. We removed a bulk of 50 cm of ileum with the signs of chronic adhesive peritonitis. Pathology incidentally identified a so far unknown T3-neuroendocrine carcinoma and six positive nodes. 18FDG-PET then revealed 2 residual lesions in the mesentery, so that we decided to re-operate on the patient. 10 days before her second surgery she had an 111In-Octreotide +scan that confirmed the PET-results. During laparotomy we performed a thorough exploration of the mesentery with a hand-held gamma-detector (C-Trak + ). The probe identified four additional nodes the involvement of which was proven by frozen section. The margins after the resection that we then performed were all clear.
Results. Re-stagings three and nine months after surgery including PET, Chromogranine A, and 5-HIA were negative for residual or recurrent disease, and the patient is perfectly well.

Conclusions. The intra-operative use of a gamma-probe for 111In-Octreotide + may allow for stage-adjusted surgery in NET of the small bowel. Methodik. 1987-2007 haben wir 62 Patienten mit einem histologisch nachgewiesenen NET operiert. Im genannten Zeitraum haben wir 4176 Patienten mit entsprechender Klinik akut appendektomiert bzw. 101 Patienten wegen einer tumorbedingten Dü nndarmstenose operativ versorgt. In der Appendektomie-Gruppe zeigte sich in 16 Fällen, in der Dü nndarmstenose-Gruppe in 20 Fällen ein okkultes NEK (insgesamt 38% aller NEK). In der Gruppe der Appendixkarzinoide, welche wegen Tumorlage, Patientenalter oder Tumorgröße onkologisch nachreseziert werden mussten, fand sich bis auf einen Fall einer lokal resezierbaren Karzinose weder eine Lymphknotenmetastasierung, noch eine Fernmetastasierung. Bezü glich des T-Stadiums wurden 38% T1, 25% T2, 31% T3 und 6% T4 Tumore, und alle, mit einer Ausnahme, als hoch differenziert, klassifiziert. Bei den akut -stenosierenden Karzinoiden des Ileums waren 8 Patienten nodal, 6 hepatal oder peritoneal metastasiert. 55% wurden als T4, 36% als T3 und 9% als T2 klassifiziert, der Differenzierungsgrad war ausgeglichen.

Ergebnisse und Schlussfolgerungen. In der Appendixgruppe sind keine Patienten, in der Gruppe der NEK des Ileums 6 (55%) an einer Progression der Erkrankung bis dato verstorben. Alle hatten ein fortgeschrittenes Tumorstadium mit hepataler Metastasierung. Korrelierend zur Literatur wird das diagnostische Dilemma gerade beim Ileumkarzinoid offensichtlich. In Kenntnis des histologischen Befundes sollten dennoch multimodale Therapiekonzepte zur Verbesserung der Ü berlebensrate bzw. der Lebensqualität angestrebt werden.
Controversial items in the treatment of neuroendocrine liver metastases H. Cerwenka
Background. Due to the rarity and heterogeneity of the disease, some questions on treatment of neuroendocrine liver metastases remain difficult to answer.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. Six controversial items are discussed using the most recent literature, published guidelines and own experience.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Results. 1) Is it profitable to remove neuroendocrine liver metastases when the primary tumor cannot be completely removed? Yes, if 80-90% of the total tumor load can be resected (debulking). 2) Is it profitable to remove neuroendocrine liver metastases if they cannot be resected completely?
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: The answer is similar to the first one. 3) Is a synchronous resection of primary tumor and liver metastases profitable? Yes, if the overall extent of the operations is tolerable for the patient, if not a two stage procedure with intermittent medical therapy is preferable. 4) Can detection of all lesions be improved by additional imaging techniques? In addition to somatostatin receptor scintigraphy and CT=MRI, special PET techniques and recently developed ''theragnostics'' may be useful. Moreover, intraoprative ultrasonography remains an indispensable surgical tool. 5) Is radiofrequency ablation profitable for unresectable liver metastases? Data are not yet sufficient, but promising. 6) Is liver transplantation an option? Yes, but only for highly selected patients with favorable tumor biology.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. Due to the variety in biological behaviour, some conventional treatment strategies must be seen differently in patients with neuroendocrine liver metastases. Generally valid rules must be carefully adapted to every single patient providing tailored treatment and interdisciplinary approach. Background. The main indication for microvascular reconstruction of the face is the best possible functional and aesthetic outcome. In several cases of reconstruction of the alveolar ridges of the mandible or maxilla extraoral scars might have been avoided, if microvascular anastomoses may have been performed without extraoral approach.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. In six patients with severe defects of the alveolar ridge of the mandible or maxilla caused by trauma or atrophy reconstruction was performed with the use of microvascular bone flaps. Here 3 microvascular corticocancellous femur flaps, 2 iliac crest flaps and one osteoperiosteal fibula flap was used. In every case only an intraoral approach was used for preparation of the transplant bed and the facial vessels. The transplants were fixed to the defect side by miniplate and miniscrew osteosyntheses. The anastomoses were carried out via intraoral approach between the donor vessels and one branch of the facial artery and vein or the main artery and vein themselves. The patients were followed up radiologically and clinically for 6-24 months postoperatively.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Results. There was no flap loss or severe complication postoperatively. All patients had good functional and aesthetic results and have been treated successfully with implants 4 to 6 months after microvascular reconstruction. Five of six patients have already been treated with implant retained prostheses.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. Intraoral anastomosing of microvascular bone flaps is a reliable technique for microvascular reconstruction of the alveolar ridge with severe defects not caused by tumour diseases. Here extraoral scars may be avoided. Ergebnisse. Als besonders relevant konnten ab einer Defektgrösse von 2 cm im Durchmesser an der Nasenspitze deutliche Verziehunge (Anheben der Nasenspitze, Asymmetrien) beobachtet werden unter Anwendung von beilförmigen Lappen und Techniken nach Rintala. Als besonderer Problembereich erwies sich der untere Nasenspitzen-sowie der vordere Columellabereich.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Graz, Graz, Austria

body_text.text: Schlussfolgerungen. Sowohl die eigenen Ergebnisse als auch das Studium der Literatur zeigen deutlich die Vorteile von Nahlappentechniken gegenüber von Spalt-=Vollhauttransplantaten in den beschriebenen Regionen. Ab einer Defektgrösse von 2 cm erwies sich an der Nasenspitze und im vorderen Columellabereich der Stirnlappen nach Lexer am vorteilhaftesten. Methodik. In einer retrospektiven Untersuchung wurden 426 Fälle aufgearbetet, bei welchen rekonstruktive Eingriffe im Bereich der Mundhöhle durchgeführt wurden. Primäre Gaumenverschlüsse wurden exkludiert. Der Untersuchungszeitraum reichte von 1988 bis 2003 bei einem Altersdurchschnitt von 57,5 Jahren. In der ätiologischen Betrachtung fanden sich in 64% Neoplasmen, in 14% Atrophien, in 9% Traumen, in 8% Missbildungen und in 3% Entzündungen. In 17% war jeweils der laterale Mundboden und der Alveolarfortsatz des Unterkiefers betroffen, in jeweils 14% der ventrale Mundboden und der harte Gaumen, in 13% der Alveolarfortsatz des Oberkiefers und in 6% der weiche Gaumen. Zur Rekonstruktion des ventralen Mundbodens wurde vorwiegend der Radialislappen und der ventrale Halslappen verwendet, im lateralen Mundbodenbereich der Radialislappen und der Pectoralismajorlappen. Die Deckung von Hartgaumendefekten erfolgte hauptsächlich durch Resektionsprothesen und durch den Radialislappen, im Weichgaumenbereich durch kaudal gestielte Velopharynxplastiken.

Schlussfolgerungen. Im eigenen Krankengut ergibt sich ein Rekonstruktionsbedarf des ventralen Mundbodens ab einem Defektdurchmesser von 1,5 cm, im lateralen Mundbodenbereich erst ab 3 cm. Die Vorteile des microvasculär anastomosierten Gewebetransfers sind unumstritten, sind jedoch zu relativieren in der Synopsis mit dem schlechten Allgemeinzustand vieler Tumorpatieneten. Grundlagen. Patienten mit kompletter einseitiger Lippen-, Kiefer-und Gaumenspalte werden schon in frühester Kindheit einer operativen Therapie zugeführt. Zeitpunkt und Technik der operativen Eingriffe werden sehr kontroversiell diskutiert. Therapieregime verschiedener Spaltzentren sind kaum vergleichbar. Um Einfluss von Zeitpunkt und Operationstechnik auf die Gesichtsentwicklung analysieren zu können scheinen vergleichende Studien sinnvoll.

Methodik. 40 Patienten mit LKG-Spalte wurden untersucht. 20 wurden in Graz, 20 in Ljubljana therapiert. Cephalogramme wurden für die Analyse herangezogen. Meßpunkte und Meßstrecken wurden zur Beurteilung des sagittalen Gesichtswachstums definiert. Das Wachstum wurde im Alter von 6.10 und 15 Jahren ausgewertet.

Ergebnisse. Im Alter von 6 Jahren lieferten beide Zentren vergleichbare Daten. Im Literaturvergleich lagen SNA, SNB, ANB und SNPg nahe den Normalwerten. Mit 10 Jahren waren die Resultate beider Zentren vergleichbar und im internationalen Vergleich gut, allerdings lagen die Werte nun unter den Normalwerten. Die Auswertung der 15 jährige Patienten liegt noch nicht vollständig vor.

Verschiedenste Therapiekonzepte zur Korrektur von kompletten LKG-Spalten werden beschrieben. Operationszeitpunkt, Technik, sowie Erfahrung des Operateurs ist ebenso evident wie eine sagittale Wachstumshemmung bedingt durch Operationsnarben. Prächirurgische Maßnahmen werden kontroversiell diskutiert. Aussagen über den Erfolg von Therapieprotokollen könnten nur vergleichende Studien liefern.

Schlussfolgerungen. Im Alter von 6 Jahren waren die Patientenergebnisse bezüglich sagittalem Gesichtswachstum in Graz und Ljubljana als gleich einzustufen, ebenso im Alter von 10 Jahren, obgleich in diesem Alter ein sagittales Wachstumshemmnis zu verzeichnen war. Im internationalen Vergleich lagen beide Zentren sehr gut. Die Beurteilung der 15 jährigen Patienten wird derzeit in einer laufenden Studie erarbeitet und soll präsentiert werden.

Background. The aim of this consecutive study was to analyze the three dimensional movement of the mandible subsequent to distraction of the mandibular midline utilizing a tooth-borne appliance with a curved expansion screw.

Overall expansion was 5.6 AE 2.6 mm (Mean AE SD). Width increase of the models was between the canines, first and second premolars, first and second molars at the tooth level 4.0 AE 2. Fistula-in-ano denotes the chronic phase of anorectal sepsis and is characterized by chronic purulent drainage and=or the presence of an epithelialized track. The categorization of a fistula-in-ano is dependent on its anatomical location relative to the anal sphincter muscles and the pelvic diaphragm according to Parks classification: intersphincteric, transsphincteric, suprasphincteric, or extrasphincteric. Complex fistulas comprise recto-=anogenital tracks in women, Crohn or recurrent fistulas or involve between 30 and 50% of the external sphincter muscle mass and their treatment is more likely to be associated with a higher risk for impairment of continence.

The anatomical borders, which are already visible in early fetal stages, therefore serve as landmark structures during continence and potency-preserving fistulotomies and fistulectomies.

body_text.text: Background. Morbid obesity is associated with insulin resistance, chronic inflammation and premature atherosclerosis which lead to an increased cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.
body_text.section: Change of metabolic cardiovascular risk factors by bariatric operations

body_text.text: Methods and results. We studied the effect of massive weight loss induced by bariatric operations on CRP, IL-6, TNF-alpha, plasma tissue factor, IL-18, Monocyte-chemoattractant-protein-1, CD 40L, and sex hormone-binding globulin. Weight loss resulted in a significant change of the above mentioned factors.
body_text.section: Change of metabolic cardiovascular risk factors by bariatric operations

body_text.text: Conclusions. Markers of chronic inflammation and premature atherosclerosis are significantly reduced after surgically induced massive weight loss. This reduction correlates with the beneficial clinical effects of bariatric surgery on cardiovascular morbidity. Ergebnisse. Ein Rebanding wurde erfolgreich bei 29 Patienten wegen Bandleckage (n ¼ 12) und Pouchdilatation (n ¼ 17) durchgeführt (Gruppe 1). Bei 35 Patienten (Gruppe 2) wurde aufgrund von Bandmigrationen (n ¼ 11), Ö sophagusmotilitätsstörungen (n ¼ 14), Pouchdilatation (n ¼ 6), Bandinfektion (n ¼ 2), Ö sophagusperforation (n ¼ 1) oder insuffizientem Gewichtsverlust (n ¼ 1) ein RY-BP angelegt.
body_text.section: Change of metabolic cardiovascular risk factors by bariatric operations

body_text.text: Der mediane BMI stieg bis zum Korrektureingriff um 4,9 kg=m 2 (Gruppe 1) und 5,3 kg=m 2 (Gruppe 2). Die perioperative Morbidität betrug in Gruppe 10% gegenüber 6,4% in Gruppe 2. Die perioperative Mortalität für beide Gruppen betrug 0%.
body_text.section: Change of metabolic cardiovascular risk factors by bariatric operations

body_text.text: Patienten beider Gruppen zeigten einen signifikanten neuerlichen Gewichtsverlust innerhalb des Beobachtungszeitraumes von bis zu 8 Jahren. Langzeitkomplikationen traten bei 13,8% (Gruppe 1) und 8,5% (Gruppe 2) auf. Die BAROS-Auswertung zeigte ein gutes und sehr gutes Ergebnis in 85% (Gruppe 1) und 91,4% (Gruppe 2).
body_text.section: Change of metabolic cardiovascular risk factors by bariatric operations

body_text.text: Schlussfolgerungen. Sowohl das Rebanding, als auch der RY-BP stellen geeignete Methoden zur Beherrschung einer Magenbandkomplikation dar. Der RY-BP ist universeller einsetzbar, jedoch risikoreicher. Ein individualisiertes risikoadaptiertes Vorgehen führt zu neuerlicher Gewichtsreduktion und verbesserter Lebensqualität.
body_text.section: Change of metabolic cardiovascular risk factors by bariatric operations

body_text.text: Failed restrictive bariatric procedureconversion or revision: a prospective long term follow-up study

Background. Vertcal Banded Gastroplasty (VBG) and later Adjustable Gastric Banding (AGB) were the standard procedures in restrictive bariatric surgery over decades. Conversion to a roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB) has been advocated after the failure of restrictive procedures. The aim of this study was to assess the effect of laparoscopic treatment of complications linked to VBG and AGB with a focus on Revision (AGB) or Conversion to RYGB.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Hospital Hallein, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. In a prospective study the outcome of patients with a Laparoscopic reoperation after VBG and AGB were analyzed. Patients with a B.A.R.O.S. score (Bariatric Analysis and Reporting Outcome System) over 1 point were considered for an AGB less than one point considered for a RYGB and included into the study.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Hospital Hallein, Austria

body_text.text: score over 1 and 46 with a score <1. All reoperations were planed laparoscopically. Fourty five patients (20.7%) had multiple laparotomies. We had one conversion to open surgery. In two patients an AGB procedure was not feasible and abandoned due to adhesions and abscess in an eroded banded gastroplasty. We noted 6 perioperative (3.7%) non fatal complications (1 pulmonary embolism, 1 esophagogastric and 1 gastric perforation with intraoperative repair, 2 pneumonia, 1 biliary peritonitis with band removal and 1 trocar wound bleeding). No perioperative or postoperative mortality was noted. In the converted AGB group two complication reoperations (1.1%) were converted to open surgery (biliary peritonitis and postoperative abcess formation after AGB) and none in the RYGB group where no anastomotic leak was observed with no statistical difference in complications between AGB and RYGB, respectively. The hospital stay was 4.2 AE 1.3=range 2-10 days for AGB and 8.4 AE 0.9 days (p < 0.001). The mean follow-up was 63 þ 1 À 44.5 months (6-76 months) with a current follow up rate of 96%. The mean BMI at follow-up was 30.6 AE 5.1 (63% EWL from initial weight) for AGB and 29.6 AE 5.1 (68% EWL from initial weight) for RYGB, respectively.
body_text.section: Results. Between September 1999 and February 2007 we operated 142 patients after failed open VBG with a BAROS

body_text.text: Conclusions. The treatment of complications after VBG with an AGB and RYGB is safe and effective. Failed VBG and AGB with an initial good to excellent BAROS result should be considered again for a restrictive procedure, namely the adjustable gastric banding procedure with a shorter operating time and hospital stay.

body_text.text: The international consensus summit for sleeve gastrectomy in New York 2007

Over the last 15 years, obesity surgery has developed tremendously. The two most frequently laparoscopically performed procedures are the adjustable gastric banding and the gastric bypass. A new intervention has recently appeared: the sleeve gastrectomy, an essentially restrictive intervention consisting of a vertical gastrectomy including the entire greater curvature of the stomach while leaving in place an approximately 100-ml gastric tube along the lesser curvature. Sleeve gastrectomy (SG) was initially added as a modification to the biliopancreatic diversion (BPD) and then combined with a duodenal switch (DS) in 1988. It was first performed laparoscopically in 1999 as part of a DS and subsequently done alone as a staged procedure in 2000. With the revelation that patients experienced weight loss after SG, interest in using this procedure as a bridge to more definitive surgical treatment has risen. Benefits of SG include the low rate of complications, the avoidance of foreign material, the maintenance of normal gastro-intestinal continuity, the absence of malabsorption and the ability to convert to multiple other operations. Reduction of the ghrelin-producing stomach mass may account for its superiority to other gastric restrictive procedures. SG should be in the armamentarium of all bariatric surgeons. Nonetheless, long-term studies are necessary to see if it is a durable procedure in the treatment of morbid obesity. Especially in orofacial surgery anatomic form, function and esthetics present an inseparable unit with any deflection in reconstructive and esthetic surgery resulting only in camouflage of the respective disease.

Aim of this investigation is the evaluation of HTK-N46, a new cardioplegic solution, in comparison to its precursor Custodiol (HTK) in failing rat hearts.

body_text.text: Methods. In male Sprague Dawley rats myocardial infarction (MI) was induced by LAD ligation. Six weeks after MI 16 animals were randomly assigned to two groups, HTK (n ¼ 8) and HTK-N46 (n ¼ 8), respectively, and evaluated on a red cell perfused isolated working heart, during 45 min of baseline measurements, 60 min of subsequent ischemia and 45 min of reperfusion. Hemodynamic parameters (e.g., stroke work index, SWI; stroke volume, SV; left ventricular systolic pressure, LVPsys) were recorded, biochemical (high energy phosphates, HEP) and histological evaluation performed. Mean AE SD.

Due to HTK-N46 treatment recovery of LVPsys was significantly improved as well. There was no difference in heart rate and HEP content.

body_text.text: Conclusions. In failing rat hearts, HTK-N46 shows superior cardioprotective properties according to postischemic hemodynamic recovery and biochemical markers compared to its precursor HTK. body_text.text: Effects of assisting maneuvers on robotic suturing of experimental coronary anastomoses in a beating heart model Background. Robotic endoscopic CABG is mostly performed as solo surgery. We aimed to investigate whether manual assistance can reduce suturing times and enhance the anastomotic suturing technique in TECAB.

Methods. In isolated pig hearts the right coronary artery was excised pedicle-like (resembling the IMA) and sutured to the LAD using the daVinci TM telemanipulation system. 7=0 Pronova was used to perform the anastomosis in running fashion. The heart was kept in pulsatile motion by an intraaortic counterpulsation device placed in the left ventricle at 80 bpm. In group I (n ¼ 15) the suture was carried out by the console surgeons (n ¼ 3) in a solo version, in group II (n ¼ 15) the anastomosis was assisted with an endo-forceps.

Results. One assisted anastomosis was not completed because of technical difficulties. The anastomosis time was 20.1 AE 5.1 min in assisted vs. 19.0 AE 3.5 min in non assisted cases (p ¼ ns). The comfort level on a scale from 1 to 10 was higher in assisted procedures (7.7 AE 1.8 vs. 6.4 AE 1.9, p ¼ 0.05). There was no difference regarding time for placement of silastic tapes or the intracoronary shunt (p ¼ ns). Suturing problems occurred in 6=15(40%) of assisted anastomosis and in 7=15 (47%) of nonassisted anastomoses (p ¼ ns). All anastomoses were patent on inspection and by probing in both groups.

Conclusions. In a wet lab model of robotic coronary anastomoses assisting maneuvers do not decrease suturing speed and occurrence of technical challenges. Similar suturing quality can be achieved if the suture is carried out in solo fashion or assisted. Suturing comfort, however, seems to be higher in assisted procedures. Background. Cardiopulmonary Bypass is known to affect cytokine release, leading to a generalized endogenous immune reaction similar to that of sepsis (Intensive Care Med 2004; 30: 1468 -1473 . Th2-type response is enhanced, resulting in production of IL-10 and ST2. Cytokine release after CABG, especially soluble ST2, has been investigated only up to 24 h after operation.

Methods. Sixteen patients who underwent CABG with extracorporeal circulation were included. Serum samples were drawn before surgery, 60 min after and on every postoperative day for eight days. ELISA was utilized to detect soluble ST2, IL-4 and IL-10 to identify Th2 response, IL-6, IL-8 and IFN-gamma for Th1 response.

Results. Serum levels of soluble ST2 (pg=ml) started to ascend after 60 min (1, 571.12 AE 890.23 ) and peaked significantly 24 h after the operation (13,356 AE 2,838,84, p< 0.001) compared to preoperative amounts (2.54 AE 2.54). ST2 levels decreased gradually, reaching a low point on the eighth day. Levels of IL-10 rose to a maximum at 60 min returning to initial levels 24 h after the operation. IL-6 and IL-8 levels both peaked 60 min after surgery. IL-8 levelled to initial values 24 h after the operation while IL-6 decreased to normal levels on day 4. IL-4 and IFN-gamma did not change during the study period.

Conclusions. In conclusion, our results demonstrate that soluble ST2, a protein with known immune suppressive capacity, is significantly increased until 72 h after surgery. This data provides an additional aspect in the understanding of immune suppression after CABG operation. Methodik. Im Tierexperiment wurde bei 14 Schafen ein kardiopulmonaler Bypass verwendet. Die Aorta ascendens wurde geklemmt und kristalloide Kardioplegielösung infundiert. Nach 30 min wurde nachkardioplegiert. In der Gruppe I (n ¼ 7) wurde NADH zur Kardioplegielösung beigegeben. In der Kontrollgruppe (Gruppe II, n ¼ 7) wurde Kardioplegie ohne NADH-Zusatz verwendet. Nach 60 min wurde die Aortenklemme geöffnet und das Herz reperfundiert. Nach einer Reperfusionsphase von 60 min und einer Stabilisierung der hämodynamischen und elektrophysiologischen Parameter wurde der kardiopulmonale Bypass beendet. Nach einer neuerlichen Reperfusionsphase von 60 min wurden Myokardstücke aus dem linken Ventrikel entnommen und mit patch-clamp Technik untersucht. Weitere Stücke wurden mit der Gefrierzange entnommen und in flüssigem Stickstoff bis zur weiteren Analyse gelagert.

Ergebnisse. NADH-Zusatz zur Kardioplegielösung führte zu einem signifikanten ATP-Anstieg (p < 0,05) im Vergleich zur Kontrollgruppe. Der Unterschied an ATP-Werten spiegelt eine Verbesserung des metabolischen Zustandes in der NADH-Gruppe wider. Weiters wurde der Ladungszustand der Zellen, der den Energiestatus repräsentiert, verbessert.

Schlussfolgerungen. Zusatz von NADH zur Kardioplegielösung scheint ein vielversprechendes Mittel zu sein, um den Energiezustand von Myokardzellen zu schützen. Background. Protease activation as well as inflammatory responses contribute to organ damage in response to ischemia and reperfusion (IR). In this study we investigated the role of SLPI in ischemia=reperfusion injury and cardiac transplantation.

Methods. SLPI-=-mouse hearts and WT controls were transplanted immediately or after 10 h of cold ischemia (CI). Recombinant SLPI (rSLPI) was added to the preservation solution or given systemically. After evaluation of function, grafts were removed at indicated time-points and investigated for histology, SLPI, TNF-, TGF-and protease expression.

Results. Early graft function was profoundly diminished in SLPI-=-hearts exposed to CI and associated with high protease expression. Systemic administration of rSLPI had no effect, however, when SLPI was added to the preservation solution, organ function was restored. At 10 days, inflammation, myocyte vacuolization and necrosis were significantly more severe in SLPI-=hearts. SLPI gene expression was detected in WT mice at 12 and 24 h and was significantly higher after CI. SLPI protein was observed at 24 h and 10 days. High intra-graft levels of SLPI achieved after administration of rSLPI were inversely correlated with protease activity early and TGF-expression late after reperfusion.

Conclusions. SLPI plays a crucial role for early organ function and the inflammatory response after ischemia in cardiac transplantation. A dual inhibitory effect on protease and TGFexpression might be considered the underlying mechanism. Background. Cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) by pacing the left and right ventricles is an emerging option for treatment of severe heart failure with ventricular conduction disturbances. Currently, access through a coronary vein is the technique of choice to achieve left ventricular (LV) pacing. Unfortunately, this approach carries significant limitations and drawbacks. DESIGN:Prospective, blinded, multicentric, clinical pilot-study testing the feasibilty of the newly constructed ''Double Disk'' lead (Medtronic model 13033) as a pure investigational device for solo attachment to the pericardium.

Methods. Since December 2006, when this electrode was used worldwide for the very first time by thoracoscopic technique in a male patient, a total of 15 heterogenous endstage cardiomyopathy patients was operated by means of VATS, mini-thoracotomy or robotically enhanced endoscopic approach (Da Vinci).

Results. Mean ejection fraction (EF) was 20.5%, all patients were in NYHA III-IV and had undergone failed coronary sinus implantation attempts before. Mean operation time from touching pericardium to definitive delivery of 2nd electrode tip was 21.75 min. During surgical procedures there were no serious adverse events, all patients were extubated promptly. At 6-month follow-up mean EF was 38%. Electrophysiological measurements of the ''Double Disk'' electrode revealed stable thresholds. The mean threshold was 1.5 V at 0.5 ms. The ventricular signal was 10.5 mV, while pacing impedance was 663 ohm at 5.0 V.

Conclusions. Advantages of this concept are: 1) No direct damage to the epicardium=myocarium. 2) No risk of penetrating coronary veins or arteries. 3) Simple and fast electrode positioning. 4) Use of minimally invasive standard tools. 5) Only two simple holes in pericardium needed. 6) Easily repositionable electrode tips.

Chirurgischer Verschluß eines sersistierenden Ductus arteriosus Botalli: Kann diese Therapie auch an einem Zentrum für Erwachsenenherzchirurgie in guter Qualität angeboten werden? Schlussfolgerungen. Gegenüber den in Tabelle 1 angeführten Arbeiten, insbesondere der von Raval mit der weitaus größten Fallzahl, zeigen unsere Daten trotz der hohen 30-Tagemortalität in den Jahren 1987-1992 vergleichbare Ergebnisse. Wir sind daher der Meinung, dass die vor Ort Versorgung der oft nicht transportfähigen Frühgeborenen auch in einem Zentrum mit niedrigen Fallzahlen insbesondere in Kooperation mit einer kinderchirurgischen Abteilung in guter Qualität und sicher angeboten werden kann und auch erfolgen soll. Background. Endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR) is a commonly used therapeutic procedure for Barrett's esophagus. We have developed a new technique for EMR that utilizes a cold blade. The absence of cautery allows an exact histological analysis of the resection margins.

Methods. The mucosal resection technique used was based on a new flexible device (SafeStitch Medical Inc.). The instrument consists of a flexible tube with an integrated distal excision capsule. A transnasal endoscope is introduced into the device for visual orientation. A guillotine blade resects the mucosa. After visual endoscopic identification of the metaplastic area suction pulls the mucosa into the capsule. To assure the correct cutting depth and haemostasis we inject an adrenaline solution. Mucosal excision is performed with a single proximal-to-distal pushing movement of the blade. After removing the device from the esophagus the specimen can be easily orientated for the pathologist. The device was studied for completeness of mucosal resection, uniformity of depth, and safety characteristics of the procedure.

Results. A total of 10 excisions were performed on ex-vivo fresh cadaveric human esophagi. The specimens average size was 2.75 Â 2.35 cm. Ninety-eight percent of 150 areas examined microscopically included the muscularis mucosa. In some excisions deep submucosal gland units were present. The average depth of submucosa excised was 0.297 mm.

Conclusions. This new device demonstrated reliability and reproducibility of satisfactory excision depth for use in mucosal resection for Barrett's esophagus. Further preclinical study is underway to refine the device for clinical application and study. Background. EMR is increasingly propagated as ''curative treatment'' for early esophageal carcinomas. However, this approach is severely violating oncologic principles and adressing it as ''curative'' seems inappropriate.
Methods. A literature review was performed and ten major reasons were identified which clearly indicate the inappropriateness of EMR, when the therapeutic aim is cure.

Results. 1) In the majority of cases, EMR can only be performed as 'piecemeal-technique', with removal of the tumor in several pieces. 2) Only in the vast minority of cases a complete ('R0') resection can be achieved with EMR. It is furthermore questionable if it is even justified to apply this R-classification to the fragemented EMR specimen. 3) Early esophageal carcinomas may be associated with lymph node invovement, depending on depth of invasion. 4) It is impossible to accurately define depth of invasion prior to EMR. 5) Esophageal neoplasms do frequently have a multifocal growth pattern. 6) The precancerous mucosa (Barrett's esophagus) remains within the patient. EMR is ''. . .similar to pulling weeds out of a garden and expecting them never to grow again''. 7) Persistence of the underlying etiology: The gastroesophageal reflux is not prevented by means of EMR. 8) Severe impairment of quality of life: Life-long follow-up endoscopies are mandatory. 9) Psychooncologic inadequacy: Patients have to live with the unresolved oncologic problem and the certainty that treatment was not curative 10) Adequate survival data are missing.

Conclusions. EMR for early esophageal adenocarcinoma is not a curative treatment. Addressing it in this way should be strongly discourraged. Background. The adequate management of patients suffering from esophageal perforation still remains a therapeutic challenge emphasized by different treatment options reported in literature. The aim of this retrospective study was to review indications, morbidity and mortality of esophagectomy as compared to less aggressive treatment methods.
Methods. The study was performed on the basis of a clinical review of 62 patients suffering from esophageal disruption treated at one centre of general thoracic surgery between 1990 and 2006.

Results. Esophagectomy was performed in 32 patients, 23 patients were treated with primary repair and 7 patients got conservative treatment as well as endoscopic stent implantation. Sepsis as a main parameter in the treatment algorithm was diagnosed in 36 patients and 32 of 36 patients were treated with esophagectomy with a mortality rate of 18.75%. Mortality rate in the group treated with less aggressive methods was 3.33%. The overall mortality was 11.29%.

Conclusions. The policy of primary repair should be adopt whenever possible in patients with no intrinsic esophageal disease and no sepsis. However, the more critically ill the patient, the stronger the argument for esophageal resection. This approach may be the only chance to terminate continued mediastinitis, pleural contamination and loss of saliva and gastric juice through the fistula in order to offer a better chance of survival.

Stenting in patients with obstruction of intestinal tract external stoma. It presents an effective method for bowel decompression as palliative treatment of preparation for curative therapy. Based on our results, the impact and limits of the method are presented.

Methods. In the past 3 years, 24 patients (between 56 up to 92 Years of age) with manifestation of the bowel occlusion have been intended for an implantation of a self expanding metallic stent (SEMS). Stents with diameter of 30 MM and length 90 and 113 MM have been used. Implantation was performed under X-ray and endoscopic control. Stent was delivered if the wire guide succeeded to pass the stenosis.

Results. Each one pyloroduodenal and jejunal stent were implanted with palliative intention, within the jejunal stent has been false positioned. In patients with colonic obstruction, one denied stenting, in next foud did not succeeded to pass the stenosis with guide wire. The stent has been false positioned once and rupture of the stricture occurred in the next patient. Effective colon SEMS implantation succeed in 15 patients.

Conclusions. Implantation of SEMS in our patient collective has been successful only in 66%. The method is safe and effective, when the guide wire passed the stenosis. For the future applications of NOTES in surgery we assessed the necessary tools and equipment as well as human resources needed for future NOTES centers.

Methods. The literature was screened in the time period January 2000 to November 2007 for research and development in NOTES and several reports and abstracts of 2007 were reviewed. Special focus was given on tools and equipment for operating theatres, the needed human resources as well as the educational problem for further NOTES teaching.

Results. Tools and adequate endoscopes are still not available on the market. Several prototypes which are used are described and sound promising, but it will still take several years to get them commercially available.
Conclusion. NOTES is a new era in surgery, but it will only partially replace laparoscopy as it will not be suitable for all patients and indications.

Time is not ready yet for NOTES out of experimental or clinical settings. Several years will be needed for adequate tools to be commercially available. Results. In total 239 patients were analyzed: 62 patients were treated with OP, 102 patients with CV and 75 patients with AD. Mortality rates were 47=62 (76%) for OP vs. 38=102 (37%) for CV vs. 27=75 (36%) for AD (p < 0.01). There was no difference in age and in mean ICU LOS; 38.6 days for OP, 30 days for CV and 36.4 days for AD (p ¼ 0.25 Kruskal Wallis Test). The APACHE II scores were higher in the AD group, AD: 19.3; OP: 18.9 and CV: 16.8 (p < 0.002) and there were no significant differences in age between the groups.

Conclusions. We found in our study that VAC Therapy could significantly reduce mortality. The VAC ''abdominal dressing''therapy appeared to be a more efficient treatment option in patients suffering from open abdomen following secondary peritonitis.
Surgical management of perforated sigmadiverticulitis with fecal peritonitis using abdominal VAC + to reduce rate of colostomy A. Perathoner, H. Weiss, D. Öfner, R. Margreiter, R. Kafka-Ritsch

Background. The standard surgical management of acute perforated diverticulitis with fecal peritonitis is still the Hartmann procedure. We present a new concept of treatment of perforated diverticulitis using abdominal VAC therapy to reduce the rate of colostomy and improve morbidity and mortality of acute complicated diverticulitis.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. Between November 2006 and September 2007 30 patients underwent emergency laparotomy at our department for acute perforation of the colon. Eleven patients with perforated diverticulitis and fecal peritonitis (Hinchey IV) were included in this prospective study. Surgical treatment consisted of extensive peritoneal lavage, resection of the perforated colonic segment and application of abdominal VAC therapy to reach rapid clearence of the peritoneal cavity. A colostomy was performed only in patients with deterioration despite VAC therapy, preoperative incontinence or bedridden persons in permanent need of nursing.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Results. The median age of patients was 72 years (range 55-81). Five patients ended with a terminal colostomy, two of them died due to severe sepsis with multiorgan failure. The length of abdomial VAC therapy varied between one and six days (median 3 days) with two or more VAC changes in six patients. Three patients developed a superficial wound infection. The median length of hospital stay was 17 days (7 days intensive care unit).
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. The abdominal VAC therapy is a simple procedure, that facilitates a rapid clearence of the abdominal cavity with a high rate of primary anastomosis, acceptable morbidity and fast recovery of patients with fecal peritonits due to perforated sigmadiverticulitis. was to assess whether endoscopically assisted GSV stripping is comparable both surgically and regarding patient quality of life with the standard surgical technique of crossectomy and stripping.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. Consecutive patients with primary GSV varicosis were randomly assigned to the two described methods. Combined endpoints of the study were haematoma at the thigh, ecchymosis, seroma, wound healing complications, infections and the change of score for the SF-36 quality of life assessment during follow up at one and four weeks postoperatively.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Results. Sixty consecutive patients were enrolled in the study and randomized to endoscopic (n ¼ 30) and to traditional (n ¼ 30) stripping. The combined rate of postoperative morbidity was 32 events (53%), 13 (42%) events in the endoscopic and 19 (63%) in the conventional group (not significant). Regarding the SF-36, patients in the endoscopic group had significantly less pain (p ¼ 0.03). At four weeks, patients in the endoscopic group had significantly less pain (p < 0.005), better physical function (p < 0.005) and physical role (p ¼ 0.01).
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. In this pilot study, endoscopically assisted stripping of the GSV has superior results compared to traditional stripping regarding postoperative quality of life in a randomized population. This method has the potential for general surgeons to compete with endovenous varicose vein therapies. Mit dem Ziel der Kostenreduktion im stationären Bereich besteht im Krankenhauswesen eine Entwicklung zur Verkürzung der Liegezeiten. Seitens einer bedarfs-und ressourcengerechten stationären Aufnahme-u. Belegungsplanung haben sich in der Chirurgie Patientenmanagement Systeme bewährt. Die Umsetzung eines patientenorientierten stationären Entlassungsmanagement als Endglied der Prozesskette gestaltet sich häufig jedoch nicht unproblematisch. Ohne eine qualitativ abgesicherte häusliche Nachversorgung bedeutet dies in vielen Fällen insbesondere auch für postoperative chirurgische Patienten häufig ,,Krisenmanagement.'' Lösungen für dieses Konfliktpotential wurden von hospital-to-home + -mobile Gesundheitsservices entwickelt und prototypisch bei der klinischen Einführung begleitet. Auf der Basis des Konzept von hospital-to-home + -mobile Gesundheitsservices wurde an der Klinik für Viszeral-, Transplantations-, Thorax-und Background. Thyroid surgery can be followed by 3 typical complications i.e. recurrent laryngeal nerve injury, postoperative hypoparathyreoidism and haemorrhage, which can delay discharge from the hospital. Can we perform 24 h surgery for economic reasons?
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. We carried out a quality-control study to analyze the critical events after thyroidectomy focusing on arguments against early discharge. For the early prediction of hypoparathyreoidism, a prospective study was performed; for the risk of recurrent nerve injury and postoperative haemorrhage, data from large retrospective studies of our patients were analyzed.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Results. Long term hypocalcaemia can be excluded on the first postoperative day, when calcium level is 2.2 mmol=l or more (60% i.e. 489=819 of patients undergoing thyreoidectomy). Bilateral nerve injury is a very rare complication (0.1% in benign thyroid disease i.e. 5=4330) and can be verified on the first postoperative day. Out of 26,054 thyroid operations 428 patients had to undergo reoperation for postoperative haemorrhage (i.e. 1.6%), 8 of them with the first sign more than 24 h after the operation (from 25 to 35 h). 1 patient was reoperated after 64 h due to unclear respiratory distress to exclude haemorrhage with slow onset. In addition, the cost-effectiveness of the reduced hospital stay will be evaluated.
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. Safe discharge after thyreoidectomy is possible 36 h after surgery when the potential occurrence of severe postoperative complication is excluded. The limitating factor is the risk of postoperative haemorrhage. However, the Austrian DRGsystem and the performance-based hospital financing do not allow cost-effectiveness for a shortened hospital stay in thyroid surgery. Methodik. Während der letzten 10 Jahre wurden insgesamt 37 Kinder=Jugendliche (14 Mädchen und 23 Knaben=Burschen, Alter zwischen drei Monaten und 18 Jahren) wegen einer reizlosen resp. entzündlichen Hauteinziehung=Porusbildung= Hautöffnung im Sakrokokzygealbereich untersucht. Bei 9 Säug-lingen=Kleinkindern handelte es sich um ,,echte'' und bei 2 um ,,unechte'' (außerhalb der Rima ani gelegene) Hautgrübchen. Sonographisch war bei keinem Patienten eine besondere Ursache für die Malformation zu finden. Porusbildungen waren bei 5 Säuglingen=Kindern festzustellen; die dazugehörigen Fistelbildungen endeten, wie lokale=spinale Sonographie (und MRT) ergaben, in 3 Fällen blind und in 2 Fällen im Spinalkanal. Bei 18 Kindern=Jugendlichen waren die Hautöffnungen auf einen Pilonidalsinus zurückzuführen; in einem Fall handelte es sich um eine blande Form, in 6 Fällen um chronische und in 11 um abszedierende Formen (4 davon waren spontan perforiert).
body_text.section: Department of Surgery, Medical University of Innsbruck, Innsbruck, Austria

body_text.text: Ergebnisse. Von den Säuglingen=Kleinkindern mit ,,echtem''=,,unechtem'' Sakralgrübchen wurde eines wegen einer Abszeßbildung inzidiert, alle anderen bedurften keiner Therapie. Die blind endenden Fistelbildungen wurden exzidiert; die Kinder mit den intraspinalen Fistelbildungen wurden einer neurochirurgischen Behandlung unterzogen. Bei allen Kindern=Jugendlichen mit Pilonidalsinus wurde nach Gewebsexzision bzw. Abszeßinzision eine offene Wundbehandlung (bei 2 mit VAC-Systemunterstützung) durchgeführt.

Schlussfolgerungen. Hautgrübchen=Porusbildungen=Hautöffnungen im Rima-ani-Bereich bedürfen einer exakten Diag-nostik, um die mögliche Ursache (dysraphische Fehlbildung oder langwierige erworbene Erkrankung) festzustellen und einer adäquaten Behandlung zuführen.
Postoperative course and long term follow up after colectomy for slow transit constipationis surgery an appropriate approach?
S. Riss, T. Brsan, F. Herbst, A. Stift

Background. Constipation is a frequent clinical complaint. Patients who do not respond satisfactorily to common medical treatment are considered candidates for colectomy. The present observational long term study was designed to assess outcome after surgery.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. Twenty consecutive patients were treated by colectomy for slow transit constipation between 1996 and 2004. Preoperative and postoperative data were reviewed by using our institutional database. A questionnaire including validated scoring systems and questions about complications and subsequent surgical interventions was sent to all available patients.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Results. Three patients (15%) died perioperatively. Median long term follow up was 84 months. Ten patients (50%) needed further operations after colectomy: three patients (15%) had surgery during the early postoperative period, seven patients (35%) during follow up. A total of 31 operations had to be performed in these patients. Twelve patients (60%) responded to the questionnaires. Their median Wexner constipation score was 11.5 (range 8-23). Six patients fulfilled the Rome II criteria for constipation. The median Vaizey incontinence score was 7.5 (range 0-22). The median GIQLI showed 80 points (range 32-129).
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. Morbidity and mortality rate after colectomy were inadmissibly high. Taking into account the poor functional results, we cannot recommend colectomy for slow transit constipation. Background. A perineal approach to treating rectal prolapse is ideal for frail patients. Internal rectal prolapse has been successfully treated with transanal resection using the Contour + Transtar TM . This technique has been modified to the perineal stapled prolapse resection (PSP), a new procedure for external rectal prolapse.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. From July 2007 to November 2007 8 female patients unsuited to transabdominal treatment of rectal prolapse were recruited prospectively for PSP. Doing PSP the prolapse was first opened longitudinally with a straight stapler and then resected step by step 2 cm proximal to the dentate line with a curved reloadable stapler. Feasibility, complications and reinterventions of the procedure were assessed.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Results. In all patients PSP was performed without intraoperative complications. The median operating time was 32.5 min (range: 22-45). To resect the prolapse six stapler-cartridges (5-8) were needed. The median specimen weighted 79 g (25-132) and measured 85 mm (60-150) in length. A moderate bleeding occurred after starting anticoagulation in a patient with artificial heart valve 5 days postoperatively. The bleeding stopped without intervention after reducing the anticoagulation. At follow-up, all patients were well and showed no early recurrence of prolapse.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. PSP is a safe and easy surgery to perform for rectal prolapse. Functional results and long-term recurrence rate must be investigated further. Methodik. Anhand eines standardisierten Dokumentationsbogens wurden prä-, intra-und postoperative Daten erhoben, wobei klinische Symptome, ODS-Score, Inkontinenz-Score und Lebensqualität präoperativ sowie 6 und 12 Monate postoperativ dokumentiert wurden. Sämtliche Daten wurden anonymisiert per Internetdokumentation (,,online eCRF'') in das Register eingegeben (26 Zentren). Die Rekrutierungsphase betrug 1 Jahr (5=2006-5=2007). Die aktuelle Auswertung bezieht sich auf eine Datenanalyse vom 14.09.2007 (n ¼ 335) , wobei die primären Endpunkte Komplikationen, ,,ungünstige Ereignisse'' (adverse events) und Mortalität darstellten.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Ergebnisse. Von 335 Patienten (79% Frauen, mittl. Alter 57 Jahre) waren prä, intra-und postoperativ komplette Datensätze auswertbar. Präoperativ zeigten 78% einen inneren Rektumprolaps sowie 73% eine ventrale Rektozele Grad II-III. 6 Monate nach STARR-OP wurde eine signifikante Reduktion des Symptom-Severity-Score (21,4 vs. 16,6) und des Longo-ODS-Score (10,4 vs. 6,5) erreicht. Im Rahmen des Follow-up wurde bei 282 Patienten (84,2%) weder eine Komplikation noch ein ungünstiges Ereignis dokumentiert. Häufigste postoperative Komplikationen waren: Komplikationen der Staplernaht 7,2% (24), Nachblutung 3,0% (10), Stenose 1,5% (5) sowie Harnverhalt 1, 2% (4) . Schwerwiegende Komplikationen traten bei 2 Patientinnen auf (Rektumnekrose, retroperitonmeales Hämatom; 0,5%) auf. Die Mortalität lag bei 0%.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Schlussfolgerungen. Die prospektive Evaluation der STARR-Operation im Rahmen des deutschen STARR-Registers ist notwendig, um den definitiven Stellenwert der Operation beim ,,ODS'' zu analysieren. Die Ergebnisse belegen die Sicherheit des Verfahrens, die Langzeitergebnisse hinsichtlich Funktion und Lebensqualität müssen abgewartet werden. Background. Global protein expression analysis (proteomics) has emerged as an exciting novel technology recently successfully applied to several fields of medicine. However, no data are currently available that investigated patients undergoing bariatric surgery by means of serum proteomics.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Methods. Sixteen morbidly obese patients (11 females, 5 males; BMI >40 kg=m 2 ; mean age 41.5 AE 10.2 years) were included in this study. All patients underwent laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding. Serum protein expression analysis pre-and postoperatively was performed using fluorescence two-dimensional difference gel electrophoresis (2D-DIGE). Spots of interest were subjected to nanospray ionization tandem mass spectrometry (MS= MS) and the spectra were then searched against SwissProt database. Expression of selected proteins was confirmed by Western blot analysis.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Results. Mean follow up after gastric banding was 998 AE 207 days. Significant weight reduction was achieved in all patients. Serum 2D-DIGE enabled to identify a total of 1132 protein spots. For 110 of these protein spots, the expression level pre-operatively was more than twofold different from that observed post-operatively. Spots with highly significant differential regulation identified with MS=MS were derived from coagulation factor-II, alpha-2-macroglobulin, serine-proteinase-inhibitor, complement component-4B, hemopexin, cystatin-A, ceruloplasmin, catenin, apolipoprotein-A-I and inter-alpha-inhibitor-protein-H4.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Most excitingly, the protein with highest altered regulation (>5-fold) was identified as apolipoprotein A-IV, a recently described hypothalamic satiety factor involved in the control of food intake and body weight regulation.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Conclusions. This is the first clinical 2D-DIGE study demonstrating that serum proteomics might hold great potential for eminent insights into metabolic regulations pre and post surgical interventions in morbidly obese patients.
body_text.section: Department of General Surgery, Medical University of Vienna, Vienna, Austria

body_text.text: Long-term results after laparoscopic adjustible gastric banding in adolescent patients

Background. During the last years increasing numbers of children have been reported with a body mass index (BMI) higher than the 85 th percentile in the western world. Surgical strategies are still discussed controversially in adolescent patients, because of the impact on further maturing process.
